results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music (Hustle Room/WCSwing Room & Mixed Ballroom/Latin Room), great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson with Mixed Social Dancing in an adjacent room. Then the DJ's take over at 9p and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes pre-party class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 7 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: Ask desk to direct you to your Organizers: Lori & Cindi
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

group.name: The Manhattan Ballroom & Latin Dance Meetup Group

results.description: Dinner and or drinks first? ;)
results.name: Gwen Stefani

results.description:
Join 100+ members for this unique singles party! It's a fun, new way to connect! This will be one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($10, goes up to $15 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Oct-17-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door). Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Oct-17-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Oct-17-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Mix & Match Singles Mingle (Ice Breakers, Drink Specials, Prizes) Prepay Only

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.
results.name: Singles Mix & Match Happy Hour - Over 100 pre-paid

results.description:
You know pretty quickly whether you and another person have friend chemistry. So to help with meeting people and hopefully making long-lasting new friends, I wanted to organize a speed friending event for women (if all goes well a co-ed event down the line). 

Just like speed dating, chat with a potential new friend for 3-5 minutes until the bell rings and then meet your next potential, at the end of the evening maybe you can have a couple of friendship contacts.

For more cool events, become a VIP member and RSVP here: 

https://www.citysocializer.com/#socials/78940
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.citysocializer.com/#socials/78940
results.name: Speed Friends Event (Women only please)

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Join 100+ members for this unique singles party! It's a fun, new way to connect! This will be one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($10, goes up to $15 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Oct-17-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door). Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Oct-17-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Oct-17-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
ArtsRock’s first event of the[masked] season will take place on Saturday, October 17, 2015 at The Nyack Center in Nyack, New York. Entitled, “One Year & Counting, An Evening of Presidential Politics” this panel like discussion will include: John Hockenberry, is a radio news host for WNYC and Public Radio International’s The Takeaway; he’s won four Emmy Awards and three Peabody Awards; he’s worked for NPR, NBC, ABC, the New York Times, and Wired magazine; and, most notably, is a Distinguished Fellow at MIT Media Lab. He’s a key conversationalist in dialogue about technology and human enhancement, and is actively bridging the gap between today’s top technology innovators and the innovators of disability.
Nancy Giles, is an actress and commentator who currently writes and contributes to CBS News Sunday Morning.
Hendrik Hertzberg is a senior editor and staff writer at The New Yorker. He originally joined the magazine as a reporter in 1969, after active duty in the U.S. Navy. He left to become a speechwriter for President Jimmy Carter. From 1981 through 1991, he was associated with The New Republic, first as its editor, then as a political correspondent, and then as editor again. In 1992, he returned to The New Yorker.
Francis Wilkinson writes editorials on politics and domestic policy. He was previously Executive Editor of The Week. He was also national affairs writer for The Rolling Stone, a communications consultant and a political media strategist.

Nyack’s very own Elliott Forrest will moderate the discussion; Elliott is a host on WQXR/WNYC. He has hosted and produced live events from Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, Hollywood Bowl and The Jerome L. Greene Space, among others. Forrest is the recipient of a George Foster Peabody Award and two Excellence in Broadcasting Awards from the New York State Broadcasters Association.

More than a dozen Republicans and more than half a dozen Democrats have announced they are running for their party’s 2016 presidential nomination. There is a myriad of issues facing the country, how will this all play out? Who will finally take the White House and what is likely to happen in our country and around the world to shape the election? All this and more will be discussed in what promises to be an entertaining and thought-provoking evening.
###
ArtsRock - The mission of ArtsRock is to provide increased access to professional arts and multi-cultural programs for an underserved, diverse audience, in and around Rockland County. ArtsRock is a 501 (C)(3) New York Not For-Profit Corporation.
For more information or to purchase tickets, go to http://www.artsrock.org or call 855-ArtsRock.
results.name: “One Year & Counting, An Evening of Presidential Politics”

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
Hello! This is an Amazing Show- And Great promotions 

Back by popular demand! NJSO Associate Conductor Gemma New conducts as these exceptional artists—acrobats, aerial flyers, contortionists and strongmen—perform dazzling and death-defying choreography and acrobatic feats to classical favorites that will thrill audiences of all ages.

GEMMA NEW conductor
CIRQUE DE LA SYMPHONIE
NEW JERSEY SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA

Cirque de la Symphonie is a new production formed to bring the magic of cirque to the music hall. It is an exciting adaptation of artistic performances widely seen in theaters and arenas everywhere.
Artists include the most amazing veterans of exceptional cirque programs throughout the world—aerial flyers, acrobats, contortionists, dancers, jugglers, balancers, and strongmen.
Each artist's performance is professionally choreographed to classical masterpieces and popular contemporary music in collaboration. 

https://youtu.be/BeIUcC-UIKk

More info:

http://www.njsymphony.org/events/detail/cirque-de-la-symphonie-with-the-njso

Discount Tickets 

Buy Here: http://bit.ly/1sJkhoz

Enter the Promo Code "Gilligan" for Discount 

Enjoy!  Robert
results.name: CIRQUE DE LA SYMPHONIE WITH THE NJSO

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com
[masked]
(201)[masked] Cell
results.name: Saturday Tennis Social at Binghamton Racquet Club

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, get hammered, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show

results.description:
Happy Spring Everyone!

Lets NETWORK & DANCE - All for a good cause!

It has been a long and cold winter and but its all coming to an end and we step into the spring. 

So Put your wig on, wear your elephant jeans, inheal the dancing fever and get ready for a 80 & 70's night!!! All this while we make new friends and raise awareness towards Robin Hood Foundations.

We'll be ready to rock!

The Robin Hood Foundation - Robin Hood is New York's largest poverty-fighting organization, and since 1988 has focused on finding, funding and creating programs and schools that generate meaningful results for families in New York's poorest neighborhoods.  Since its founding, Robin Hood has raised more than $1.95 billion in dollars, goods and services to provide hundreds of the most effective soup kitchens, homeless shelters, schools, job-training programs and other vital services that give New York’s neediest citizens the tools they need to build better lives.

We will have a private room upstairs just for the meetup folks. I shall be collecting $3 a person and my goal is to raise $150. I shall be stopping by the offices of Robin hood Foundation next week to make the donation.

This will be a great night and one of the best boogie nights in NYC.
results.name: ***Boogie Night*** - Network & Dance on 80's Music All For a Good Cause

group.name: The Manhattan Ballroom & Latin Dance Meetup Group

results.description:
Quality Meats features modern interpretations of familiar dishes and flavor combinations, resulting in unique tastes, innovative presentations, and a distinctive Quality Meats style. The warm, industrial décor by award winning designers AvroKO draws on cues from traditional New York City butcher shops, in the use of warm wood, stainless steel, and white marble. The space succeeds in being simultaneously rustic, inviting, and luxurious with rich details. Interior details include an homage to a traditional “meat locker” interior with finished walnut planks covering the length of the downstairs dining room wall, butcher block end‑grain wood as the primary material for the staircase, and vintage market scales that have been transformed into a lighting installation in the upstairs dining room. These elements coexist flawlessly with understated accents drawn directly from butcher shop inspiration, such as white ceramic tiles, and chandeliers made of pulleys and large steel butcher hooks.

http://www.qualitymeatsnyc.com/home.cfm

Steak & Vino will reside at Holiday Inn Express Times Square:

$269 King Beds
$299 Double Double (2 beds)
$309 Triple/ Quads (3-4 ppl, 2 beds) These rates include complimentary breakfast and wireless internet access. Taxes are an additional 14.75% and $3.50. The rates will be honored on stays ranging from 15OCT-19OCT

Rooms must be reserved by 16th September 2015

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, get hammered, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!

results.description:
This event is 21 and over

It was five years ago this month that we hatched a simple idea to create a night where folks could enjoy rock, pop, R&B and hip-hop from the 1990s – without the DJ cutting off songs in the middle! We can’t believe that it’s already five years later. So please join us for Party Like It’s 1999: 5th Anniversary Edition -- where you get the gifts! The first 50 people that come up to our request table and say “Happy Anniversary” will get a special 1990s musical present created by our DJ Steve. He’ll also serve up the best mix of tunes from our favorite decade. And, as always, it’s free!

results.description:
.

Terror rides the night skies in this thriller from horror auteur Wes Craven. Lisa Reisert (Rachel McAdams) is a young woman with more than her share of anxieties about flying. However, when circumstances demand she go to Miami, she gathers her nerves and books a seat on a late-night flight. Sitting next to her is a handsome and charming man named Jackson (Cillian Murphy), whom she already met in the airport, but once their jet is safely in the air, Lisa discovers he's not the pleasant traveling companion she imagined. Jackson is part of a terrorist cell plotting to kill the head of Homeland Security, and he's decided to draft Lisa into helping him. While Lisa has no interest in abetting Jackson's plan, he soon reveals he's holding a trump card -- his compatriots are holding Lisa's father hostage, and will kill him if she doesn't cooperate. Red Eye was the first feature film credit for screenwriter Carl Ellsworth, who previously scripted episodes of Buffy the Vampire Slayer andXena: Warrior Princess.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XP0DdJ6_5xU

results.description:
This will be the Sunday after the Escarpment Traverse. This, in conjunction with the Escarpment Trail, will make for a 50 mile, 15k elevation gain weekend! 

Remember this is a Sunday. The start will be early. The days are much shorter. Please, you should be strong hiker. 

The Devil's Path is an annual HVH tradition! Every year in late April or Early May, we head to the Catskills to hike one of the best known, most grueling trails on the east coast!

http://www.backpacker.com/january-2011-readers-choice-northeast-new_york-devils_path/destinations/15048

Five peaks over 3500' .. 24 miles .. 9000' of vertical gain!

We will start at Prediger Road make our way westwards. The Devils Path winds its way westwards across Indian Head, Twin, Sugarloaf and Plateau Mountains then descends down to Devil's Tombstone campground along 214... a good spot for a lunch break.

We then ascend the southern flank of Hunter mountain. This is a fairly long ascent of 2 miles, fairly comfortable however due to numerous switchbacks. The next good resting spot is the Hunter Lean-to. After the lean-to, we start the gradual descent down to Diamond Notch Falls, a nice little spot to stop for a snack and relax by the falls.

At this point we are three quarters done and it's onto West Kill mountain via a very long ascent. West Kill has some nice views, a nice chance to pause and admire the view. After West Kill it is approximately 2 miles to St. Anne's Peak, mostly downhill. Then a 400' climb to St. Anne's Peak. After St. Anne's it is 1 mile of downhill to the sharp turn the DP makes on its way the parking lot. The last 1.5 miles is an easy descent down to the parking lot.


Expect to be hiking for 12-15 hours!

Since we will all be hiking at a different pace, try to find someone in the group who hikes at your pace - don't hike alone!

FOLKS SHOULD HAVE SOME LONG DISTANCE (20 miles or more) HIKE EXPERIENCE BEFORE DOING THIS HIKE.. THERE WILL BE NO SWEEP!

+++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Catskills DEVIL'S PATH TRAVERSE! *FALL FOLIAGE EDITION*

results.description:
My US cell phone: [masked]

I have always wanted to walk the length of Manhattan - there is so much to see and so much history on the way from the tip of Manhattan down Broadway to Battery Park.

We will start at 7:30am and finish (probably) by 5:00pm, leaving time for stops along way to eat, drink, rest and poke around the various places of interest.  The walk is mostly flat, although there are some hills in the northern part of Manhattan!  We'll wind our way down the island to South Ferry....if we feel up to it, we can take the (free) ferry to Staten Island for a great view of the Statue of Liberty. Length of hike is about 14 miles.

We will meet in front of the McDonald's on Broadway, right outside the 225th Street Subway: 5201 Broadway, Bronx, NY 10463

There are still some openings for the walk, if people want to come.  Email me directly: [masked]. THANKS!

DINNER in Manhattan the night before!  I have made reservations for 8 people at Botequim - a Brazilian place right off Union Square.  The address is 132 4th Ave.   It is actually IN the Hyatt Hotel and looks fabulous. CLICK HERE for the website. Our reservation time is now 6:00pm, but if you get there earlier, I'm sure you can have a drink at the bar!  Reservations are in my name - Julie Chilton.

NOTE! I WILL ALREADY BE IN NYC! YOU MUST MAKE YOUR OWN ARRANGEMENTS FOR TRANSPORTATION AND  ACCOMMODATION!  SEE BELOW FOR SUGGESTIONS AND LINKS!


How to get to NYC:
Cheapest way: MEGABUS
More comfortable way: AMTRAK
You could also drive to New Haven and take the Metro-North Commuter Rail
I do NOT recommend driving into NYC.

Where to stay:
I will be at the Seafarers International House, right near Union Square.
Other options in that same general area include The Larchmont Hotel,The Chelsea Lodge, The Jane, Hotel 31 and Hotel 17.

These places fill up quickly, so if you are thinking of coming, book soon.  You can usually cancel up to 48 hours beforehand with no penalty. Of course, there are plenty of places to stay in NYC, but these places are budget-friendly, clean and safe.  All are "European style" which means that you have a private room, but the toilet and shower are on the hall.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the 1 to 225th Street.  Meet in front of the McDonalds outside the subway station.
results.name: Manhattan from top to bottom - walking Broadway!

group.name: Fellowship of the Tortoise (for slow & steady hikers!)

results.description:
Leisurely paced loop of about 7km, starting at the usual parking lot at end of Lake surprise, up to the Trailside center and then via the yellow loop back down to the lake. Gorgeous piece of the reservation, and worth the uphill.


Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could happen as you willingly run across rough terrain with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start at the Queensboro bridge pedestrian path and finish at the finish line of the NYC Marathon! (PLEASE NOTE CHANGE IN START LOCATION FOR THIS WEEK ONLY!)


Details: 
TIME: 8:00am

LOCATION: Look for a big group of runner's at the foot of the Queensboro Bridge, corner of Crescent St. and QB Plaza North!

PACE: Will vary. There will be a variety of pace groups for this run. Be sure to familiarize yourself with course map before you start. Your leaders will be running a 10:00–11:00 minute pace.

DISTANCE: We will be running the last 11.5/12 miles of the NYC Marathon Course! Some of use will be running back to Sunnyside after the run for a total of 16-ish miles. Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short. If you're a faster runner, please study the route in case you wish to run ahead. 

Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

---   
Please see our full calendar of events   
http://www.meetup.com/Queens-NYC-Runners/events/calendar/ 
Like us on Facebook   
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Queens-NYC-Runners/136480849709681 
and connect with us on Google+   
https://plus.google.com/113723558494173669269 
---

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

results.description:
Hello! This is a Trip NOT to be Missed.

1st We will Tour the 911 Memorials Museum and NOT wait in the Long Long line W Priority Access.

https://www.911memorial.org/visit
Entering the museum, it’s immediately apparent how much effort and care went into it; the entire site is constructed to the highest order.
The museum is a homage to the Twin Towers themselves and their history, as well as to the events of 9/11 and its aftermath.

Its location is actually underground, beneath the plaza of the memorial—in fact, the walls of the fountains can be seen from inside the museum and there are exhibits to be seen underneath both fountains, which occupy the exact locations of each original tower.

2nd We will journey across to the the Brookfield Plaza, Lunch will be here on your own @ the

a http://brookfieldplaceny.com/directory/food

Located in Lower Manhattan's Battery Park City, a Fabulous and I do NYC Fabulous Its a great place for Shopping w  selection of World Class Eateries right on the Hudson! Perfect for Lunch

After Lunch

3rd Irish Hunger Memorial

http://bpcparks.org/whats-here/parks/irish-hunger-memorial/

The Memorial represents a rural Irish landscape with an abandoned stone cottage, stone walls, fallow potato fields and the flora on the north Connacht wetlands. It is both a metaphor for the Great Irish Famine and a reminder that hunger today is often the result of lack of access to land. The 96’ x 170’ Memorial, designed by artist Brian Tolle, contains stones from each of Ireland’s 32 counties, and is elevated on a limestone plinth. Along the base are bands of texts separated by layers of imported Kilkenny limestone.

4th We will Tour long-awaited Freedom Tower observatory https://oneworldobservatory.com/

Housed on floors 100, 101 and 102 of the nation’s tallest skyscraper, the One World Observatory will provide panoramic views and an “unparalleled opportunity to experience New York City,

We have Priority tickets Purchased in advance allows Us to visit the 9/11 Memorial Museum at Our preferred date and Time.

Please wear Comfortable shoes there is Plenty of walking !

http://www.history.com/topics/911-rebuilding-of-ground-zero

This Trip includes:

1.-RT Transposition on a  Luxury Bus {w  Tolls and Tips}   and ALL Parking fees.

2. The 9 11 Memorial Museum fees

3. Freedom Tower observatory Fees

4.  For Only $94.00pp

Please SEND Payments ASAP - PLEASE


When you RSVP -Payments MUST be made PLEASE

To Robert Gilligan, PO BOX, 184, Ridgewood,NJ 07451

or

With Credit Cards  to PAYPAL.com

My PAYPAL.COM Address is " [masked] "

Please send money "As owed to a friend" to save fees.

Thanks for your Cooperation,

Questions? [masked]

Robert

DEPARTING 8:15am

Whole Foods Market

300 Bergen Town Center, Paramus, NJ

results.description:
We are going to the North-South Lake Campground in Catskills. It is time to hike and run on some real mountains!


I can pick you up in NYC and we'll carpool all together in our RawMobile. As you can see, the number of spots is very limited, so first come first serve. The details about pick up and drop off are below. To reserve a spot just RSVP to this meetup.


Our recent day trips to the Catskills were awesome, so we're doing it again. Some folks were running, some were hiking, but all had fun and made new friends. Check out our photos and comments from the past trips.


There are lots of ways to enjoy a day at North-South Lake Campground, but the main point of interest to us is probably the famous Escarpment Trail. If you have never heard of this trail, take a look here: http://escarpmenttrail.com/ This is one of the most beautiful places for hiking and trail running in New York state.

Here is a video from the 2013 Escarpment  Trail race:

https://vimeo.com/71310538

Please note that we are not traversing the entire trail (if you really want to do all 19 miles, let me know and we'll figure out how to set it up). Also, if you're interested on doing this trip on Sunday, let me know. 

I  will get you there and back and will take care of the day pass to the campground, and also we'll have lots of fruit and bottled water for everyone. We'll also have few picnic/beach  blankets. 

We will start hiking/running at North-South lake campground. I suggest doing about 5 miles of the trail (to the crashed airplane, or maybe a bit further), and then turning around. I will be staying at the back of the group, and faster hikers/runners can go ahead of us if they want to.


The beauty of this plan is that it's impossible to get lost. The trail is VERY EASY TO FOLLOW (it is well-marked with blue markers) so you can go at your own pace and turn around when you feel like it. Just be sure to get back on time before we leave (5pm sharp).


You are welcome to hike with anyone else in the group, but all abilities are welcome and everyone can enjoy this trail at their own pace.  The trail is rugged and at times very steep. Please prepare accordingly. There is no any water on the trail, so be sure to have enough with you. On weekends there are lots of people hiking there, so we certainly won't be alone there.

Other activities that you might choose to enjoy during our trip to the campground:


- hiking around the lake,


- visiting scenic spot of Mountain House,


- renting a boat (availability might be limited),


- suntanning and enjoying the beach.

More information about the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/outdoor/24487.html


Map of the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/docs/permits_ej_operations_pdf/northsouthlake2015.pdf

There are nice showers and bathrooms right by the beach (which is also our parking area and starting/finishing point of the hike/run). There are also picnic areas with tables and benches all around the beach.



What to bring (optional):

Towel, clean clothes, flip-flops, gels, your favorite snack, map, insects repellent, rain jacket.


You will be able to leave your extra stuff in the car if needed.


Pick up/Drop off:

The main point of the pick up is bus station by GW Bridge (at 8 am sharp!). To get there you can take A train (to 175th street). 


The drive takes just over 2 hours, we'll leave NYC at 8am, get to the lake shortly after 10am, run, eat, enjoy the beach, and head out back to the city by 5pm. We'll be back in NYC shortly after 7pm.

If you don't need a ride, then just come over to the campground and meet us there, no need to RSVP here.


Bad weather cancels the trip! Please check this meetup for the updates a day before.

Cell reception: T-mobile doesn't work there. AT&T mostly does work. Not sure about the others.


Time to go to the mountains!

Legal Disclaimer

Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. Plus we'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give you a $50 Off, coupon for your "Student Package"

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. YTou can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

•  Student Information Form

*Physician Sign-Off Form This form MUST BE COMPLETED if the answer to ANY question on the "Medical Info Waiver form is YES before participating

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

If you have one, bring a copy of your coupon with you

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).

We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

DESCRIPTION:


Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.


To have a good play experience, we will put a cap of  10 on the attendee.
Please only RSVP when you are sure you will show up.

WEAR:
Sport cloth and sneaker.

BRING:
Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.
PS.If you don't have a badminton racquet, you can rent one at the center for $4 per day and $20 deposit.

LOCATION:
New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below. 


TRANSPORTATION:
Subway: #7 train to Main St. Station, 10-13 min walk.



REFERENCE LINK:

• http://newyorkbadmintoncenter.com/

DISCLAIMER:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

END

results.description:
LEADER: Roy Wooters ([masked] or[masked])

RATING: B 6 B

Meet at 9:30 am Tiorati Circle parking (no parking fee this time of year). Hike north on the AT to the Ramapo Dunderberg, take the RD to unmaintained trail and Tiorati Brook road back to parking. Lunch approximately at 12:30 pm. Heavy rain cancels. TC Map 119.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


Enjoy the "Million Dollar View" of the Catskills as the leaves change. Reminders of its earlier agricultural roots, the open fields and broad views at Spring Farm give way to quiet, forested paths in the famous Gunks Mountain range near New Paltz, NY. Enjoy an invigorating fall  day out of the city with other fun members of our group as you will be treated to some of the most breathtaking views of the Hudson Valley.

Your day will begin with the breathtaking train ride from Grand Central along the Hudson River.  The concrete and congestion of the city will melt away to rolling hills and dazzling river views.  Your guide/host will meet you at Poughkeepsie train station (the last stop) and wisk you off to a mountain range where you will spend about 2 1/2 hours hiking with a stop along the way to enjoy lunch overlooking the valley. After the hike we will visit a local winery and The Walkway over the Hudson Park. This hike includes a moderate rock scramble (climbing on boulders) it is suggested for those who are in fairly good shape.  Your guide will be with you every step of the way to ensure you are comfortable and safe. (this is not like climbing with ropes)

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

To register please go directly to www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$


$65  includes:  round trip transportation from train station to all attractions, hiking, all hiking fees.taxes and tips. You can also opt to drive to meet the group in Poughkeepsie.

What is not included: since not all will be drinking, winery tasting fee's (usually $5-$8per person), lunch. Train.

What to bring: Hiking shoes or sneakers with hard soles and good treads, sunblock, bottled water, bag lunch.

What to expect: 15 fun and friendly people who love the outdoors.

Hiking level: Moderate + The rock scramble would be a 6 out of 10 difficulty. The scramble is about 20 minutes out of the hike.

Can I come alone? Yes , 98% of those attending will be signing up on their own.

Refunds given only if hike is canceled due to rain.

You will be brought to the 5:54 train back to NYC

If you do not see a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be many people attending from other groups, YOU WILL NOT BE ALONE!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Did you forget to sing? Perhaps after Third Grade, when the peer pressure set in. Perhaps someone picked out the "Gifted and Talented" - and it wasn't you. Or maybe the Nuns made you sing "God Bless America" and someone laughed. Or you were one of the "Blue Birds" - you moved your mouth but didn't make any sound. Or did you sing beautifully in that Elementary School play? Was it the Middle School chorus, where the boys were thrown out and it ended up a Girls Club that made a sound in three parts, so beautiful nothing to this day has extinguished that feeling? Perhaps you were one of the guys who made harmony in the reverb of the Boys Room, or in the audience at the concert, or the sports stadium, or in the shower?

Or maybe you played an instrument that kept your mouth busy, and you never did get the chance to sing? Was it the race of competition for excellence in something, something else, that left you no time?

Was is the implicit warning, between the lines of the praises of privilege, that you should not express yourself? Did you forget that feeling of camaraderie and being a part of something bigger than yourself? Did you forget that amazement you felt at yourself being able to memorize a large piece and give it your all - weeks and months of practice that lead to a performance, or several, that made you feel powerful, hopeful, inspired and you had drawn upon that experience to guide your life? You had that moment, lifted by the magic of the "ordered progression though time and space," that made life so rich, so romantic, so filled with spirit.

And then did you forget?

Forget that feeling, that high, that experience of joy and sadness, playing the part, being a messenger, a vessel. You forgot that there are scientific studies praising the participation in music and art, the health benefits, the raised white blood cell count, the relaxation response, the breathing, the healing power of sound, or just the old saying, "singing is good for you."

Now you have another chance.

Don't miss it.
results.name: Did You Forget to Sing?

results.description:
After Saturday's portion of the challenge, I can say two things:
1) We had a GREAT time seeing lighthouses we've never seen before, and
2) there is NO WAY we are going to get to all of the rest of the lighthouses on Sunday. :(
The distances are such that one must choose between a race and appreciation for where we are. We chose appreciation today, and we're glad we did.
Each car may have its own route, of course, but my car will be doing 3 or 4 lighthouses to be decided when we meet.
-----

NJ Lighthouse Challenge is an annual event where all the lighthouses are open, and there are treats and such as you go along. Will we get to them all? Sign-up and weather will determine the exact plan - will we leave Friday or Saturday night and stay over? Do half Saturday and half Sunday? Return home in between? Stay in a motel? To be decided... If you think you are interested, please sign up and let me know your preference.

Update Oct. 13:

It's finally here! The NJ Lighthouse challenge!
At the first stop, you buy a $2 entry sheet to participate in the challenge. Each lighthouse and life-saving station in NJ has a souvenir to give out and will validate the entry sheet - at the end, completed entry sheets are eligible for a drawing. Here's the website for more info: http://lhchallengenj.org/

Here's the plan:

Saturday, Oct. 17, 8am - 6pm:

Leave the church at 8am (other cars may leave from other locations and meet us) and head to the first lighthouse along the Delaware River. We will make our stops as short as possible (20 min?) in an attempt to reach as many lighthouses as possible. I think just the driving added up to more than 8 hours, so I don't expect to reach all of them the first day. We will reach as many as possible by 4PM and then head home, most likely by 6pm. Bring food, or expect to eat take-out in the car while riding.

Sunday, Oct. 18, 10am - 4pm???:

Pick up where we left off, or start at Sandy Hook and work our way down to finish all of the route - departure time and route direction will be determined by the end of Day 1, based on how many lighthouses are left to see and whether there's someplace we want to spend a little more time. I expect 10am-4pm (so those who wish to, may attend 8am church), but that may change, so check the night before.

Follow us one day, both days, or do it on your own! You might even choose to spend the night wherever we end up after the first day.

***Limited space is available for non-drivers, so do let me know right away if you want me to try to find a carpool for you.***

RSVP for one or both days by Thursday, Oct. 15

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
Ready to be amaaazed? To commemorate the 200th anniversary of the Star Spangled Banner, we've chosen an American flag design for this year's Amazing Maize Maze. Kids and adults alike will have fun finding their way out of this 3-acre corn labyrinth! The adventure begins with a "Stalk Talk" to prepare you for the challenge of finding clues, solving puzzles and making your way out of the maze. Feel up to the challenge? Then join us for the fun of getting lost and loving it!

Click here for more info

Afterward, we will head to Oyster Bay for Oyster Festival

Welcome to Oyster Festival

The Oyster Festival, the East Coast's largest waterfront festival, returns this October for its 31st year, offering a fun mixture of new activities and old favorites that are certain to entertain the entire family. The Oyster Festival originated as a hometown parade honoring Theodore Roosevelt before evolving into the largest outdoor festival on Long Island, under the auspices of the Oyster Bay Rotary. Every year, more than 200,000 visitors flock to an Indian-summer weekend on the waterfront in downtown Oyster Bay – drawn by live entertainment, Tall Ships, top-notch artisans, pirate shows, midway rides, and the iconic oyster eating and shucking contest. And of course…the Food Court, where volunteer chefs and culinary pros work side by side, cooking and serving dozens of unique oyster, clam and other seafood concoctions along with traditional festival fare.

Click here for more info.

Date: October 18th Sunday; please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 10:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 10:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map).

Return: Depart from Oyster Bay at 5:00 PM and get back to Flushing at around 6:15 PM & Manhattan 7:00 PM.

Cost: Early birds $39 for first 8 spots or 21 days in advance; afterward Regular $49.

Trip includes: Round trip Benz Sprinter van transportation from NYC, admission to corn maze, and admission to Oyster Bay Oyster Festival.

Buy Ticket Here: http://oct2015oysterfestival.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, you can transfer your spot to other with $10 transfer fee.
* 100% refund if the trip is cancelled due to bad weather or vendor close down.

Pictures from the previous trip

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/25290012/

By RSVPing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
ABOUT ME: 

Hi, my name is Monica, I'm an accountant turned professional model. I like to have fun with photoshoots! I'm not afraid to try new looks, poses, etc., feel free to direct me or fix my hair how you would like it. Don't be shy! Tell me the look you are going for! You will get the best shots if you are communicative and have fun with the shoot too. :)

Follow me @

https://instagram.com/topxrahman/


Now on to the Main Event!

The Theme 


Bollywood! Lavish indian dress (cropped midriff top, long skirt, ornate shawl). Think bright colored fabric against a backdrop of flowers.

Here is an example of a lengha (the style of dress I will be wearing to the shoot):

The Place

We’ll shoot at the Central Park Conservatory Garden.  The Conservatory Garden is Central Park's six-acre formal garden. It is divided into three smaller gardens, each with a distinct style: Italian, French, and English. 

The Italianate center garden is composed of a large lawn surrounded by yew hedges and is bordered by two exquisite allées of spring-blooming pink and white crabapple trees. A 12-foot high jet fountain plays on the western end of the lawn, backed by tiered hedges and stairs that lead up to a wisteria pergola. 

The northern, French-style garden showcases parterres of germander and spectacular seasonal displays (chrysanthemums in autumn), all within an ellipse of Japanese holly. In the center is the charming Three Dancing Maidens fountain by German sculptor, Walter Schott. 

To the south is the very intimate English-style garden. There are five mixed borders of trees, shrubs and perennial plants, and five seasonal beds featuring spring bulbs that are followed by annual flower displays. A slope of woodland plants lines the western edge of this garden. At the center is sculptor Bessie Potter Vonnoh's lovely Frances Hodgeson Burnett Memorial Fountain, a tribute to the author of the children's book, The Secret Garden. 

Meet At:   

The garden's main entrance through the Vanderbilt Gate, on Fifth Avenue between 104th and 105th Streets. I will be hard to miss looking like an Indian princess. Be there as early as you like, but at 10am sharp we move into the conservatory. Please make sure you give me your cell number when you register!

The Shoot: 

Photographers will shoot in 10 minute increments, with the option to use waiting photographer(s) as assistant(s). The shoot should last between 2-1/2 to 3 hours. depending on how long wardrobe changes (if any) and my breaks are. 

The Fees:  

Regular fee  $107 per photographer . 

EARLY BIRD  $80 (Register on or before: Friday Oct 16) 

================== 

HOW TO PAY:

Payment for this meetup is done through TheModel'sDen Paypal account.  After you RSVP an invoice will be sent within a few hours for payment. 

-- > $ 30 Non-refundable deposit is due within a few hours after your

Balance of $50 in cash is due the day of the event, plus any surcharges you may have agreed to. -  Please bring exact change.

==================== 

CANCELLATIONS: 

Please note! -  Events are not cancelled because of inclement weather.  I will make the decision no less than 2 hours before the event.  You will be notified by all the following means:  posting on this event page; email; a text message and a call if no response is received from you.

ALWAYS Check this event page 2 hours before the event starts to be kept informed of the status.  

==================== 

Why TMD? 

So many groups are crowded with photographers, a massive paparazzi nightmare.  At TMD, it's just the model, you and at the most 3 other photographers that help and assist each other.  There will be times for paparazzi shoots. Those are for promotional purposes.   

Models don't expect or request copies of the images. And photographers are not obligated to share.  Sure, if you happen to have a spectacular image feel free to post it for everyone to see.

You get what you pay for: TMD models are interviewed and if their portfolio is lacking, they are test shot.  

At TMD, the models are more than just models, they are business people, hospitable & creative. They understand that photographers are here to learn, experiment and have fun!

results.description:
I love me some football. Yes, the fake American kind, not the “Futbol” the rest of the world clamors for. I used to play but the old bones and joints are having none of that these days. I think I’ve found a suitable replacement with none of the risk of putting me in traction for 3 months. Let’s play a bit of Ultimate Frisbee.

If you don’t know, now you know…

Ultimate Frisbee is a game structured similar to football minus the danger of bodily injury. You have two teams, a playing field and two end zones; the goal being to advance the frisbee down the field by throwing it to your teammates and catching it in the end zone to score points. That’s it. So utterly simple my five-year old nephew could play. Ok, there are a few more rules to the game but not many. Check ‘em out here
ULTIMATE FRISBEE GAMEPLAY AND RULES.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up.
And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability; you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be running A LOT so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Bring BOTH a black and white t-shirt. This is how we differentiate teams.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup.

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute
updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• No guests allowed to play. You can bring a friend to spectate though if you need to hear the roar of the crowd.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously
plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Ultimate Frisbee (Co-ed)

results.description:
Earlier classes on Parable of Jesus and on "Our Father" prayer were excellent, whether you are Christian or not, a believer or not (Scott's comment).

Unitarian Universalists are rightfully proud of a tradition that remains open to the spiritual insights of many different religious traditions. Frequently, however, this openness masks a reluctance to explore the very traditions out of which we ourselves have emerged. In this series Rev. Robb will take a fresh look at the spiritual insightfulness and moral imagination contained in the teaching of Jesus while emphasizing how they may continue to be revelatory in our current context. It is always surprising to look carefully at the actual words of great teachers with whom we have assumed we were fairly familiar and to discover new ways of understanding and fresh insights of which we were unaware. In this series we will examine in depth some of the stories Jesus told—the parables—which were probably the most characteristic and innovative way he had to convey his own spiritual vision.


 Rev. David Robb

is Assistant Minister for Adult Education and Scholar-In-Residence at All Souls. He is also a psychotherapist and pastoral counselor in practice in New York City and an Associate of Kenwood Psychological Services. He formerly taught Theology at Georgetown University and Religious Studies at Connecticut College.

results.description:
Please buy your ticket ($15) here:  

http://chembonding.eventbrite.com

WORKSHOP LEADERS:

Donghong Sun (Dept. of Chemistry, Columbia University)

Tammy Gwara (Trinity School)

The periodicity of elements and chemical bonding are essential topics in introductory chemistry. However, when we teach these topics, we frequently rely on anthropomorphizing the particles in order to help students remember: “Sodium wants to lose this extra electron because it’s happier with a full valence.” Students memorize the conventions but are unable to put meaning to what they are doing.

We will demonstrate how the model of electron energy levels can be developed from patterns found in ionization energies of elements. Students will then apply this empirically developed model to explain the periodicity in ionization energy and atomic radii, as well as common charges of monatomic ions and the nature of ionic bonding. We will also develop a model to explain covalent bonding, using empirical evidence of compound formulas to derive the “combining power” of particular elements.

The workshop will follow the modeling cycle: developing the model based on evidence, deploying the model to make predictions, and then evaluating the model for flaws and developing the need for a more sophisticated model. Please bring a laptop with Microsoft Excel installed if possible.

Please buy your ticket ($15) here:  

http://chembonding.eventbrite.com
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in Zankel hall at Teachers College.  Take the 1 train to 116th Street.
results.name: Chemistry Workshop: Modeling Approach to Periodicity & Chemical Bonding

results.description:
Кунгфу класс в парке в воскресенье утром. Такое вот предложение отдохнуть, пока погода позволяет.

Привет. Меня зовут Дарья, и учить китайскому кунгфу и тайцзи - это моя профессия. Я предлагаю всем выбраться в парк и обстоятельно там поработать.
По воскресеньям я обычно провожу так называемые "basic classes", суть которых сводится к тому, что с помощью разноплановых физических упражнений я привожу тело моих учеников в хорошую физическую форму. А именно улучшаю работу сердечно-сосудистой и дыхательной систем, укрепляю мышцы, работаю над растяжкой, баллансом, координацией.. И все это в рамках китайских боевых искусств.
Из побочных эффектов тренировок: улучшение внешнего вида, в том числе осанки, общее улучшение самочувствия и ощущение возвращающейся в тело "легкости".

Что придется пережить во время занятия:
1. Растяжку, особенно ног, особенно подколенной зоны. А также разработку спины и плечевого сустава.
2. Интервальные упражнения на кардио.
3. Придется познакомится с ударами ногами.
4. И с базовыми кунфу стойками. Что значит серьезную нагрузку на бедренные мыщцы.
5. Под "удар" попадет пресс и спина.
6. А так же трицепс и дельта рук.

На самом деле, по итогам тренировки людях выходят с ощущением "это то, чего просило мое тело". Не баня, конечно, но... кстати, баня после такой тренировки - это самое оно!

Узнать подробнее про меня можно на моем сайте https;//kungfu-fm.squarespace.com
С вопросами можно писать и звонить напрямую на мой телефон[masked]

Sturdy, comfortable sneakers/hiking boots

Platform program presented by Bart Worden, Leader of the ECSW.

The core idea of Ethical Culture, that by eliciting the best of others we elicit the best of ourselves and create a more ethical society, is based on a premise that individuals have worth in and of themselves and are to be treated accordingly. That is not easy to do when people are faced with individuals who have no apparent redeeming qualities or people whose values and intentions conflict with one's own values and intentions. Recent research into how people make moral choices may provide us with helpful ways to understand how morality works in individuals and the impact of culture on moral behavior. These findings may also point us to helpful strategies for elciting the best of each other


Light refreshments after the program.

Ethical Education for Children regular classes today.

results.description:
Bonjour! Join me on a Journey through the past and discover some of Manhattan's hidden treasures! In these diverse Harlem to Washington Heighs neighborhoods, you will see some of the most beautiful townhouses, unique architecture and historic sites. We will start with the Audubon Terrace (was once the home of painter and naturalist John James Audubon) and now is occupied by Manhattan’s only active cemetery (Trinity Church Cemetery).

We'll also visit the Hispanic Society of America with an extraordinary collection of art and artifacts from Spain, Portugal and Latin America. Then we will reach the Hudson river for lunch and we will see Manhattan's only remaining lighthouse, made famous by the children 's book, "The Littke Red Lighthouse and the Great Gray Bridge". Rounding out the tour will be a stop at the Malcolm X Memorial then the delightful Morris Jumel Mansion, Manhattan’s oldest house built in 1765 which once served as General George Washington’s headquarters in 1776 and where in 1790 as President he dined with members of his cabinet: Thomas Jefferson, John Adams and Alexander Hamilton. We will also stop by the homes and apartments of some of the figures of the Harlem Renaissance (Duke Ellington, Count Basie, W.C Dubois..).

NOTICE THAT :

-The Jumel Mansion has a $5 admission charge : $4 for students and seniors.

-The Hispanic Society of America have free admission and restrooms.

-The meeting time is at 10:30 AM.

DIRECTIONS ?

The #1 subway gets you right there. Note you can also take the A train to 168th Street either walk, ride Broadway bus or take the #1 downtown one stop.

-Right across the street there is a great coffee shop named Tazco (http://www.taszo.com) where you can use the restrooms. There are restrooms at the Hispanic Society of America and by the place we will stop for lunch.

-If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, just please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Merci !

In case my phone number is[masked]/[masked]

A bientôt !Alex
