results.description:
The Year of the Runaways by Sunjeev Sahota is not available in the United States so we are reading The Awakening which we had planned to read in the future. 

The Awakening, originally titled A Solitary Soul, is a novel by Kate Chopin, first published in 1899. Set in New Orleans and on the Louisiana Gulf coast at the end of the 19th century, the plot centers on Edna Pontellier and her struggle to reconcile her increasingly unorthodox views on femininity and motherhood with the prevailing social attitudes of the turn-of-the-century American South. It is one of the earliest American novels that focuses on women's issues without condescension. It is also widely seen as a landmark work of early feminism, generating a mixed reaction from contemporary readers and critics.

The novel's blend of realistic narrative, incisive social commentary, and psychological complexity makes The Awakening a precursor of American modernist literature; it prefigures the works of American novelists such as William Faulkner and Ernest Hemingway and echoes the works of contemporaries such as Edith Wharton and Henry James. It can also be considered among the first Southern works in a tradition that would culminate with the modern masterpieces of Faulkner,Flannery O'Connor, Eudora Welty, Katherine Anne Porter, and Tennessee Williams.

results.description: Modern paganism, witches -- what do you make of this? Some are bewitched, some bothered, some bewildered. Nearing Halloween, it's easy to see how disrespected the word "witch" is in our current American culture. Think: Salem witch trials for some history. In some parts of the world, people are still being put to death on suspicion of being witches. What can we all learn from the more public re-emergence of practices and ideas rooted in religions which predate the major monotheisms of the West? What can we learn from the tendency towards witch hunts and witch crazes? With Jone Johnson Lewis, Interim Clergy Leader

From NJ: The State Route 23/County Route 519 split is located approximately 1 mile southeast of the entrance to High Point State Park. From this point, follow Mountain Road (County Route 519) north for 2.3 miles to the Appalachian Trail crossing. Park on the shoulder of the road.
results.name: High Point-Appalachian Trail from Mountain Road

results.description:
This Sunday's" Completion"  Workshop Meet-up is happening this Sunday at 11AM - 12:30PM.  We had some amazing clicks last weekend and are sure to have more.   So please carve our an hour and a half for your self, your spiritual work, for loving yourself through the science of completion with Past as we gain the knowledge, insight, and transformation.

Nithyananda says: "Only with the deep completion, listen, only with the deep completion you even become one being.  Without completion, you can’t even be one being.  Please listen!  Please come to the space of listening!  Listen!  Many times even you do not know what you want to achieve in the life.  You do not know what is the purpose of life.   It is just because of incompletions! ...

See, it’s like each part of your incompletion claims, ‘I am you!’  ... Each broken part goes on claiming, ‘I am you!’, ‘I am you!’, ‘I am you!’  And one of the worst things is, one part of you spends so much of energy to disprove the other part is not you.  So finally, whoever wins, whoever loses, who is the loser?  You!  One part of you winning is not you winning.  Even if one part of you wins, you are the loser!  Unless your whole wins, you are a loser! 

Understand, each part of you screaming that, that part is you, finally lands you in such deep confusion, such deep confusion.  Unless you heal yourself and bring yourself to completion; unless you bring yourself together; align you as one being, life doesn’t start for you! 

Please listen!   All great spiritual practices and all great spiritual processes, everything--the purpose is for you to become ONE; for you to become complete, integrated!

The whole country, the whole civilization, the whole spiritual tradition is suffering just because of not having completion with one another.  We do not have completion with one another.  That is the most unfortunate thing.  Neither we have completion with ourselves, nor do we have completion with one another.  The broken parts of us go on abusing one another. 

Understand, whether he is a construction worker working for daily wages, or the IT engineer, or the lawyers, doctors, whatever may be, when you bring completion, so much happens to your system.   When you complete continuously, one more thing, completion is not a one-time process.  It should be taken as a continuous lifestyle.

Understand, only if you start living completion, you will understand the quality of life.  I tell you, when there is incompletion, your life is stolen away from you!  When the completion happens in you, you regain your life! 

Let me define “Completion”:

“Completion” is removing the delusion of incompletion, which makes you cognize the other is separate from you.  The delusive cognizance, the delusive cognition!  Understand, incompletion has no existence; it is only a delusive cognition.  Incompletion is the delusive cognition that stands between you and the Whole.  Complete with everything!
results.how_to_find_us: Contact:  Ma Nithya Samarpini
results.name: Learn Completion and win the war happening inside you!

results.description:
*****************Please do not look for the guy with the hat (Thomas), since he will not be there. I will be guest hosting (david). We will still meet at the same spot (marked below) at 11 am (we'll wait 10 minutes or so for the latecomers) and I will introduce everyone. If you are going to be significantly later, send me a message for my cell # to text. Domo Arigato!

Hi Everyone! I'm doing this event again and I would like to set up with those that are interested. We're going to crawl around different vendors to eat varies food. This event is mainly to explore the variety of food vendors so you are all welcome to join me and stay for the shows afterward.

We will meet across the street on West 95th st. from subway exit where the benches are.

This event is free and no organizer fee will be charge.  Just come out and enjoy the day. This is the event program and if you wish to go there early and explore by yourself, catch some of their shows, you are free to do so. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

ABOUT the Event

With a wide range of Japanese food, arts, crafts, services, and performance, there is plenty to do and see for everyone!

Bring your family and friends and explore this extraordinary cultural event all day long. We are sure you will have a GREAT time with a lot of fun and excitement at the Japan Block Fair!

FOOD
The wide range of Japanese food is one fun part of the fair. From authentic noodles and curry to neo-Japanese cuisine and delicious sweets,we offer a large selection of delicious and healthy Japanese food at reasonable prices!

PRODUCTS
Just stroll around and take your time to browse through a variety of Japanese merchandise, arts, crafts, and more. Hard-to-find handmade jewelry and traditional Japanese wraps are some of the items showcased — enjoy the treasure hunt of a lifetime!

http://youtu.be/C2QDLymMsg8

PERFORMANCE
Come join us for an energetic stage live performance! Japanese cosplay (costume play) performances, traditional dance, Japanese rock band, Drums, samurai performances… there is something for everyone. Best of all — it’s all FREE!

http://youtu.be/4XWPfP8JdpE

We will start exploring at 11:00.

* If you arrive late or going to be late, just text me.

(°∀°)b

results.description:
Linda Richards, Hudson Valley Songstress, has entertained the people of the Hudson Valley from school auditoriums to the decks of the sloop Clearwater for over thirty years. Linda’s Power of Song program for youth musicians performing “cause music” grew and delivered message music to thousands of people from 2009 – 2015. Her unique new music education program for children will launch in the fall of 2015 and will engage children in songs which reflect social awareness and coach them in participatory performance strategies. A regular at the Great Hudson River Revival and Mohonk Mountain House, Linda is also a member of the Vanaver Caravan’s “Turn Turn Turn”, sharing Pete Seeger’s visions through song and dance.

Everyone is welcome to attend our Sunday morning platform meetings!
results.name: Platform: Linda Richards on Social Change Through Music

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 Saturday and Sunday runs.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

The A/B & B/C breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  


***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://www.nyurban.com/basketball/open_play_bb.html

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.
results.name: Basketball Open Play- Sunday Morning-  Brandeis 11:15 AM

results.description:
I have heard Rev. Kimberleigh Jordan several years now and each time has been excellent, highly recommended! Note: after the talk, there is coffee/cake socializing.

Performance artist, social activist, spiritual leader and dance historian, Rev. Jordan will lead this three-part exploration based on her experience in all four realms. What is common to both the human body and the body politic is that both undergo change through resistance and yielding, tension and resolution. We will look at the meanings of resistance from diverse perspectives—from the dance to exercise culture, to social and political forms of resistance.  We will share stories about resistance, screen performances, and engage in interactive discussion.
  Performance examples will include the work of choreographers Katherine Dunham and Alvin Ailey, as well as everyday people making resistances moves against apartheid in South Africa, tyranny in China, and in the #BlackLivesMatter protests in NYC.

Rev. Kimberleigh Jordan is an interdisciplinary scholar working at the intersection of religion, dance, and African Diaspora Studies. Her research and teaching interests include religion, ritual and worship, critical dance studies, dance history ethnography, and womanist/feminist theory. She teaches in the Fordham University/Alvin Ailey Bachelor of Fine Arts program, and was a[masked] Ford Postdoctoral Fellow at Union Theological Seminary, New York City. An ordained minister of the United Church of Christ, she is a native of North Carolina and holds degrees from the University of North Carolina (AB), Union Theological Seminary (M.Div.), and the Tisch School of Arts at N.Y.U. (Ph.D.). She has also studied in the Professional Training Program of the Dance Theater of Harlem.

Creative Struggle: Dance, Resistance and Social Change Sundays, October 11, 18, 25  (11:15 a.m.)
with Rev. Kimberleigh Jordan, Ph.D.

results.name: Creative Struggle: Dance, Resistance and Social Change

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

We gather in the saloon's back room, where we have enough privacy to have different conversations around the several large tables, as well as the big one led by Dorothy Kahn. The expanded pub-grub menu has been enhanced with an $11 breakfast special, the Bloody Marys are hot, the beer is cold, and conversation sparkles. results.description:
Welcome back to the Uncommons, it's been a crazy few weeks, and with Nightmare Night hot on our heels it's high time we take a moment to sit down and enjoy a game or two.

The Uncommon's is Manhattan's very own Gaming Cafe, where we spend Sunday afternoons playing a variety of board games, ranging from the simple card games to the deviously strategic games. One thing's certain, there is certainly a game there for everyone, and there's certainly enough people to play them with. Be it Ticket to Ride or Tokaido, Jenga or Pony Races, there's something at the Uncommons for the strategists, the warmongers, the casuals and even pony-fans like us.

You're welcome to bring your own games, however we recommend you ask below to find out whether or not the Uncommons already has it and if there are other players interested in playing. We strongly recommend you travel light, as space is at a premium - be sure to show up early/on time to ensure yourself a seat.

There is a $10 (+tax) rental fee for the afternoon which covers your seat and any and all games you play from opening until closing at 11 PM (which we quite frequently stay until.

http://mubronyclub.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/games_ponies_play_by_blayaden-d5wlg3e.png?w=1024&h=634

Have any questions, comments or concerns? Feel free to post below and we'll help you out as best we can.

results.description:
Are you looking to BALANCE your training & stretching?

Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

Looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track?

Would you like to RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by combining it with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL balance your whole being in training!

Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements (overuse) on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten in ingrained patterns around muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga class, one can better release tension, move with ease, and benefit from improved posture and injury prevention.  In addition, increased respiratory control and focus have been reported by students.

The Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with series of held Yin floor postures to open the meridian/chakras pathways of the body. While surrendering into the edge of each pose for 2-5 minutes, students are guided in the cultivation of observance and breath, as they experience release of connective tissues and the stagnant energy around the hips, thighs, and lower back. Awareness is emphasized to sensations in the body that are grounding and powerful experience of the NOW. The Yang or moving practice allows students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for circulation, and flexibility, into vigorous strengthening postures and movement sequences. Freedom of breath, alignment, and mental clarity will be elicited deeply during, after the class, and into one's training.

After our INTRO CLASS ON 9/10: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

AND another student reported achieving best time running a 18 mile course...


**10 Classes Only - Join weekly for maximum benefits and donate suggested $15 per class for this this performance enhancing class not offered anywhere else in NYC!


Please message me other days/times for Spring Program Offering considerations.  Thank you!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

results.description:
Greetings, earthlings!


It's been an exciting week with the lunar eclipse and discovering water on Mars. Coincidentally (not really), things tend to happen in threes, and well, we decided to change it up this year and instead of doing a Halloween themed shoot, we're bringing back our Sci – Fi pin up themed shoot, scheduled for Sunday, October 18th! We will be paying tribute to the retro futurism of B movies of the '50s and '60s, bringing bombshells to alien planets and space labs of the ‘future’.  

This shoot is for PHOTOGRAPHERS! 

We plan to have one area for green screen and a space station set. If you have props you would like to lend for the day, please email us! We encourage you to create some of those campy (read: "cheesy") posters of days gone by. Think: Ed Wood, Barbarella, Flash Gordon, etc....

Check out some of the shots from our last shoot, as well as some of my inspiration from old movie sets and posters.

 Models scheduled to attend:

1) Agent Wednesday ~ https://instagram.com/agentwednesday/ 

2) Petite Renard ~ https://www.facebook.com/petiterenardburlesque?fref=ts

3) Stockholm filly ~ https://www.facebook.com/stockholm.filly?fref=ts

Prices are as follows:

RSVP by 10/1: $75

RSVP by 10/7: $85

RSVP by 10/12: $95

RSVP by 10/17: $105

pay at the door: $115- {But please contact us to find out if spots are still available. It is advisable that you contact us the night before.}

RULES:

By participating in this shoot, you agree to upload your best images here on the meetup site in a timely fashion. We cannot stress enough: PLEASE upload your photos here to the meetup page. It is a requirement for participating. This is the central location where all models, hair stylists, wardrobe stylists, and makeup artists can access the photos. It is not cool for the style team (or models!) to have to hunt around facebook, instagram etc. for photos. We would all love to see the results of our collaboration! 


We will be setting up continuous video lighting. You may not bring tripods or other equipment that will get in other people's way.  


Please TAG us on social media! 

We're @nypinupclub on instagram, twitter and tumblr

We have a facebook group and a facebook page! Follow us!


See you there, space invaders!
results.name: Queens of Outer Space - a Sci-fi B movie themed shoot!

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12pm-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

Image a short story or essay being accepted for publication. This is not only possible, but doable and it only comes with putting fingers on the keyboard. 

Join me and others on Sundays for writing camaraderie. 

We can start the new year with a reading or two of works completed in this 4th quarter cycle.

Who ever said down home Southern food can't be made vegan has not been to this cooking class. Jenné Claiborne is going to teach you how to make some amazing southern staples without using an ounce of butter, pork, or any other animal product. This Georgia native has been a professional vegan chef for three years, and making southern food vegan has been a joy of hers for even longer. We won't be using any mock meats in this class, rather relying on whole foods to do the job. 

In this class you'll learn how to make: 

Creamy Mac & "Cheese" 

Perfect Smokey Collards

Spicy "Crab" Cakes

Strawberry Shortcakes 

More info and ticket: https://goo.gl/lPcjka

results.description:
Updated October 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

FALL (Sep - Nov)

As the city cools down we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on weekdays and Morningside Park for weekends.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End) 
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Damien 
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

results.description:
I happened to find myself in Salem, MA in September and visited the house-inspiration for the novel - such an interesting tour.  And since it's October it seemed like a fitting choice!

"The House of the Seven Gables is a Gothic novel written beginning in mid-1850 by American author Nathaniel Hawthorne and published in April 1851 by Ticknor and Fields of Boston. The novel follows a New England family and their ancestral home. In the book, Hawthorne explores themes of guilt, retribution, and atonement and colors the tale with suggestions of the supernatural and witchcraft. The setting for the book was inspired by a gabled house in Salem belonging to Hawthorne's cousin Susanna Ingersoll and by ancestors of Hawthorne who had played a part in the Salem Witch Trials of 1692. The book was well received upon publication and later had a strong influence on the work of H. P. Lovecraft. The House of the Seven Gables has been adapted several times to film and television." - wikipedia


The novel is set in the mid-19th century, although it includes glimpses into the history of the house, which was built in the late 17th century. 


____________________________ 

** NOTE : I WILL BE EMAILING MEMBERS ASKING YOU TO CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE MEETUP, WITH YOUR REPLY DUE NO LATER THAN APPROXIMATELY 24 HOURS BEFORE THE EVENT SO WE CAN GET A PRETTY ACCURATE HEADCOUNT. PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE A "YES" RSVP TO A "NO" IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE, SO MEMBERS ON THE WAITING LIST HAVE A CHANCE TO READ THE BOOK. AND REMEMBER TO SEE THE "PAGES" LINK FOR THE NO-SHOW POLICY, IT'S STRICTLY ENFORCED. THANKS
results.name: October Brunch - The House of the Seven Gables (Nathaniel Hawthorne)

results.description:
Sunday afternoon!

"If my calculations are correct, when this baby hits 88 miles per hour... you're gonna see some serious shit." --  Dr. Emmett Brown

You have a date with "density" on October 18th to discuss "Back to the Future."

Whether you're a casual movie fan or seasoned cinephile, this workshop is a fun opportunity to learn more about what goes into the craft of moviemaking.

We'll take a look under the cinematic hood and see how the motion picture engine runs by discussing how the following crafts are woven together to create the power of movies:


Screenwriting - Blueprint for a Movie
Acting - Breathing Life into Characters
Production Design - Sets, Costumes, Props
Camera & Lighting - Directing Visual Stories
Editing - Putting the Puzzle Together

Everyone should watch the preselected movie in advance. During the workshop, the group watches various selected scenes from the chosen flick and we dissect and discuss each scene.

The Movie Appreciation Workshop is held in the screening room of the always fun Videology Bar and Cinema in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Drinking and eating during the workshop are encouraged.

Several trivia questions about the selected movie are asked throughout each workshop. The winner gets a FREE drink ticket!

Explore movies you love, learn terminology and gain insight into the creative filmmaking process. Join other cinema enthusiasts for an entertaining and enlightening lecture/ conversation about the magic that is the movies!
results.name: Movie Appreciation Workshop: The Craft Behind Movie Magic in Back to the Future

results.description:
The Palm reader has an Opening THIS SUNDAY, OCTOBER 18th  and has offered to provide this additional activity at our brunch at the CJC for anyone who is interested! (He will be truthful about what he reads on your palm. )  This will be a BONUS and will NOT cost you more than the original $15 I had advertised. 

In addition.....

I will have a varied menu with some Healthy Options. 

I  have planned a few activities and will encourage  people to switch activities so that you try to meet everyone who attends!

1.  Schmoozing and eating of course!

2.   jigsaw puzzles and other games... scrabble, cards, yatzee, trivial pursuit,  etc.... (our "Puzzle mixer"- had a great turnout a couple of years ago) 

3. The POSSIBILITY of  a "sing along" - popular fun stuff.... run by one of our members John Gee ,who volunteered to play the piano and lead us in song if his schedule is not too busy.

4.  If we still have time, we will run a Discussion about  "New Year's" hopes and resolutions .  I will ask Bruce to start the circle discussion.... you can send me ideas about other topics you would like to talk about.

5. .... and a short complimentary Private "Palm Reading" in the Lobby ... we will give out numbers for these so that we don't have to make a line to wait your turn.

Hope to see you this SUNDAY on October 18th!  Please let me know if you are coming.... now it looks like we will have around 40 people at this event!

Martine

results.description:
Since we were so successful in the past I have invited Kris back to do past life readings with healing for those who are interested. Often times what happened to us in past lives are effecting the results of our current lives but if we discover it and heal it we can have better results in this life. Below is what Kristen has to say:

Step back in time for your channeled healing and reading facilitated by Kris Lindemann of Integrated Healing Therapies. Kris uses a combination of methods to conduct her sessions. For this special event, she will channel love healings and messages from Spirit with the Past Life Oracle as a springboard for spiritual guidance and individual healing. See who you were in a past life to gain better understanding over your present situation. Love is the answer to every question in every moment and healing is the vehicle for the light to shine. Price is $30 for 15 minute sessions. Longer appointments are available as desired. You will be served in the order you are received, so relax and socialize while you wait.

Looking forward to working with you in the energy!

So the plan is this: show up anytime from 1 till 3:30, you can come and hang out and chat with me while you wait for your turn and you can hang out after too if you want. Or just pop in and get your reading and leave. I will collect the money (cash only exact change please) and you will be read in the order that you arrive.


Look forward to seeing YOU!   Love, Cassie

Join 40+ members already prepaid in seeing one of the biggest new musicals of the year! You will also meet group members before the show at our Pre-Mingle and then sit together at the show. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/neverland/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (1pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets. 

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, closer to event date.  It will start at 1pm and we'll leave at 2:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 3pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $87.50 to $97.50 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot.  

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/neverland/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=2&v=KMjf2779BYY

Story -

Finding Neverland follows the story of author J.M. Barrie and his relationship with the family of widow Sylvia Llewelyn Davies, who eventually became Barrie's inspiration to write Peter Pan. The musical explores the power of imagination to open up new worlds, and the pressures put upon those worlds by the inevitability of growing up.
results.name: Broadway's Biggest New Hit 'Finding Neverland' w/ Pre-Mingle (Prepay Only)

Join us in seeing one of the biggest new musicals of the year! You will also meet up to 50 other members before the show at our Pre-Mingle and then sit together at the show. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/neverland/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (1pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets. 

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, closer to event date.  It will start at 1pm and we'll leave at 2:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 3pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $87.50 to $97.50 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot.  

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/neverland/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=2&v=KMjf2779BYY

Story -

Finding Neverland follows the story of author J.M. Barrie and his relationship with the family of widow Sylvia Llewelyn Davies, who eventually became Barrie's inspiration to write Peter Pan. The musical explores the power of imagination to open up new worlds, and the pressures put upon those worlds by the inevitability of growing up.
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be emailed to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date
results.name: Broadway's Biggest New Hit 'Finding Neverland' w/ Pre-Mingle (Prepay Only)

results.description:
Although the Iran nuclear deal has received substantial news coverage, there are other nuclear threats that few people in the United States think about today. The United States and Russia still have thousands of nuclear weapons, with many hundreds kept on hair-trigger alert so they can be launched in a matter of minutes. President Obama can take steps during his remaining time in office to reduce the risk that nuclear weapons will ever be used.

Lisbeth Gronlund, Ph.D. is Director of the Global Security Program of the Union of Concerned Scientists. She holds a doctorate in Physics from Cornell University, and is the author of numerous articles on technical and policy issues concerning nuclear weapons, ballistic missile defenses, and weapons in space, and has frequently testified before Congress on defense and national security issues. She has been a MacArthur Fellow and a co-recipient of an American Physical Society award for “creative leadership in building an international arms control community and for her excellence in arms control physics.” Since 1990 Dr. Gronlund has been a primary organizer of the International Summer Symposiums on Science and World Affairs which fosters cooperation among scientists around the world working on arms control and security issues.

This event is co-sponsored by the All Souls Lifelines Program, the Nuclear Disarmament Task Force of All Souls, and the NGO Committee on Disarmament, Peace and Security of the United Nations.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be in standing in back of room....I look a lot like my photo!
results.name: Nuclear Weapons in a Volatile World: Risks and Opportunities

results.description:
October 18, 2015

Explorations of Other Spiritual Paths into Voodoo & Santeria, Part II

A lecture from one who practices Voodoo and Santeria (2 hour guest speaker Santero Ian Ford) Samhain Briefing handout $25 in person/$27 via paypal - If you paid online PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

If you have any issues, please call http://www.meetup.com/CharmedByStarrWitchesofNewYork/events/220059114/chrome-extension:/lifbcibllhkdhoafpjfnlhfpfgnpldfl/call_skype_logo.png917-378-5012

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
The Underdark's Deep Wastes lay beneath the Dalelands and the Moonsea. Here drow worship their Spider Queen Lolth and plot against the hated surface world, but something new has arisen... Fire giants have taken the undercity of Maerimydra... and a dark power of self-indulgence and narcissism spreads madness... Who dares enter such subterranean realms?

Although there is no cover charge for this event, because the venue is a bar/restaurant, players should factor in ordering brunch (see menu at http://www.lovecraftnyc.com plus drink specials on-site).

We're using 5th edition Dungeons & Dragons with multiple DMs running open tables. You can download the basic rules (with 4 classes, 4 races) for free at http://bit.ly/1EzS3Uq -- new/returning players welcome, pre-gen characters and everything provided but bring dice if you got 'em along with food/drink money.

UPDATE: WE STILL NEED DUNGEON MASTERS! We've lowered the initial RSVP list ahead of a waitlist to keep the table manageable, but if more people are interested in helping run games, we can take more players! Let us know!
results.name: D&D Brunch @ Lovecraft Bar: Rage In The Underdark

This Event:


The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free. 


Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

We'll be hosting another Dungeons & Dragons Expedition in October.


Expeditions are longer, more involved sessions when compared to Encounters.

The Expedition will be organized by one of our DM's, Ann.

The Expedition will run for approximately 4 hours, with a small break in the middle of the experience.

Ann will be there an hour before the event to help with character creation or level adjustments.
The Expedition is contingent upon having enough players show up, so if you're planning to come be sure to RSVP here on Meetup.
results.name: Dungeons & Dragons Expedition

results.description:
It's time once again for our famously fabulous Howloween Costume Party, known as Boo Bash! This is our largest event of the year, and this time around, it's bound to be bigger and better than ever! Any Pug and Every Pug will be expected to be on hand for the festivities!

All Pugs in attendance are eligible to take part in the costume contest, and there will be trophies and prizes for all winners of the following categories:

Cutest

Most Creative


"Class Clown" (funniest)

Best Duo or Group

Best Human/Canine Combo

Best in Show, which will be awarded to the winner of one of these categories!

There'll be plenty of "thrills and chills", along with goodies for the humans and goodie bags for the Pugs! There will be raffles for door prizes AND the lucky "Best in Show" winner will win a Pugopoly board game!

Howlin' good times will be had by all, as we listen to all of our favorite Halloween music classics such as "Pugster Mash" and "Purple People Eatin' Pug", along with everyone's favorite, Edgar Winpug's "Frankenpug"! If this doesn't put you in the mood for a frightfully good time, *Frank-ly*, I don't know what will...

Please note that the group photo will be taken at 1:30 PM, and the costume contest will begin at 2 PM; the duration of this event is approximately 2.5-3 hours. IF YOU ARRIVE LATE, YOU WILL MISS SOME OF THE FESTIVITIES! PLEASE be considerate of your fellow NNJPE members and be punctual!

Please note that I do not post private residence addresses on the internet; thus, the actual event address and directions will be sent a couple of days prior to the event, so be on the lookout for them! Be sure to RSVP for this event as soon as possible, as we expect another sell-out crowd and we don't want you to be left in the...*lurch*!

Pugs in costume, they will be dressed;


All adorned in their Howloween best.

Some will be scary, some will be cute;

Some will arrive in their own birthday suit.

Will it be trick, will it be treat;

With any luck, there'll be good stuff to eat!

Pugs on parade, just look at them strut;

Curly tails in the air, paw to paw, nose to butt.

Everyone is welcome, the young and the old;

To party with our Pugs, 'tis an event to behold.

So NNJPE members, come far and come near;

To our 10th annual Boo Bash; 'cause we want you here!

Please note the charge for this event will be $7.00 per person (children 10 and under are free!). Net proceeds from this event will be donated to Pug Planet Pug Rescue to assist them with the ongoing care and veterinary expenses for their foster Pugs. Exact change is requested and is greatly appreciated as it will expedite check-in. Pre-payment via credit card is also available, and is encouraged; thanks!

THIS JUST IN! THE FIRST 35 MEMBERS TO SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT WILL RECEIVE A PUG MAGNET, A $10.00 VALUE! (Offer available to paid members only. One magnet per household; proceeds benefit Pug Planet Pug Rescue...)

****IF YOU RSVP TO ATTEND THIS EVENT AND THEREAFTER CANNOT ATTEND, YOU MUST UPDATE YOUR RSVP. Perpetual no-shows will forfeit their membership to the NNJPE. (I am not trying to sound mean, but I must have a minimum amount of accountability from those perpetual no-shows...it's only fair!) Please also insure that your guest total is accurate!! Expenses for this event are based upon the number of people attending; a great deal of planning goes into this meetup, so I appreciate your understanding and cooperation...thanks!

We look forward to seeing all of you, along with your costumed Pug, at this fun-filled event!

Hauntingly Yours,

Ellen B. Witching, along with our host and hostess, Steve N. Stein and his Bride Lorraine! (Wah ha ha...)
results.name: The 10th Annual NNJPE Howloween Boo Bash!

results.description:
Harvest Homecoming at New Bridge

October 18, 2015 (Sun) from 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM

Come home to history.  BCHS is a very welcoming and enthusiastic organization. The last event we had, Baronfest, several couples/families paid admission and were so intrigued  -- they came back to the gate and to trade up & join. 

Picket-fence beer garden at an 18th century tavern. Music by River Acoustic Band. Food including BCHS cider donuts & pretzels. 

Pumpkin-picking for the first 100 children. Tour three 18th c. sandstone homes & barn all connected by a gravel pathway. Walk where George Washington walked. 

Only 7 miles from the GWB. The train stop on the Pascack Valley line out of Secaucus is only 1 block away. Free parking.
Cost: Adults: $12, Students: (6-21 yr) $8. BCHS members free. Beer: (12 oz) $5. Exact cash line moves faster.


Historic New Bridge Landing, 1201 Main Street, River Edge, NJ 07661.   [masked]-9492. www.bergencountyhistory.org
results.name: Harvest Homecoming at New Bridge

results.description:
In this creative safe-space for people living with mental health issues and extreme states, we will be exploring:


1. ORIGINAL ORIGAMI

Origami is usually thought of as a rule-following sort of craft, but the truth is it does not need to be about more than the art of folding paper if you don't want it to be. What do you think we could come up with if we threw the rulebook out the window and went to work on some Origami paper?

2. ELECTROACOUSTIC SOUND COLLAGE

This is going to be a hybrid of two kinds of sound exercises we have done at PROPELLER already. Basically, we will be taking turns creating a generative sound collage by finding/creating audio loops of different lengths on the internet, as we have done before. The difference is this time people will be invited to makes sounds with their mouths/bodies/various instruments and found objects as the collage is being built and then jam over it for a while.

As always, there will be plenty of time during and after the group to hang out and get to know each other!

Hope to see you there!

-Josh K.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask staff for meeting room w/ reservation number 5610405d66a2f. You can also try asking for the event w/ "PROPELLER" in the description. If you have any trouble finding us, contact propellerproject@gmail.com. Will try to post sign on door if allowed.
results.name: ORIGINAL ORIGAMI + ELECTROACOUSTIC SOUND COLLAGE 2

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Some of the route and artists will be different from last year.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

Description: Victorian Flatbush Open Artist Studios has about 40 participating artists. These artists are opening their doors to the public and sharing their work. The artists don't charge admission to their art studios. We'll stop in some of these art studios and get a rare, intimate view of the artists' working environment. We can also talk to the artists about what they do. This art walk features painting, photography, ceramics, mixed-media, sculpture, and printmaking. 

Below is a painting titled Social Contract by Laolu Senbanjo, who will be part of the Victorian Flatbush Open Artist Studios.

Below is a Self-Portrait (2012) by Laolu Senbanjo.

Below is a painting of a Victorian house by Arturo Garcia, who will be part the Victorian Flatbush Open Artist Studios. (In 2012, Arturo Garcia was being interviewed by the Ditmas Park Corner [a daily newsletter] while he was painting the green Victorian house on Beverley Road between Westminster and Argyle Streets.)

Below is a Self-Portrait (2010) by Auturo Garcia.

We'll also be walking down streets in the Victorian Flatbush's historic districts, which have free-standing Victorian houses in various architectural styles (Arts & Crafts, Colonial, Japanese, Queen Anne, Swiss, etc.) with turrets, bay windows, stained glass windows, finials, and ornamental wreaths. Below are photos of houses in this area. We'll be visiting art studios in some of these beautiful houses.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Duane Reade Pharmacy. The address is 1517 Cortelyou Road (at the north west corner of  Cortelyou Road and East 16th Street), Brooklyn, New York. The Duane Reade Pharmacy is about one short block from the subway station, which is the Cortelyou Road station. Before the walk, a restroom is available in Duane Reade Pharmacy. There also will be restrooms available during the walk.

Below is the Duane Reade Pharmacy at 1517 Cortelyou Road.

Transportation: Take the "Q" subway train southbound to Cortelyou Road in Brooklyn, New York. Duane Reade is less than a block from the "Q' subway train stop. You can also take the 2, 3, 4, D, N, or R subway train to the Atlantic Avenue subway station and then switch at this Atlantic Avenue subway station to a "Q" subway train to Cortelyou Road. You can also take a LIRR train to Atlantic Avenue station and then switch to a "Q" subway train.

Finishing Time/Place: This art walk, which is a one-way walk, will finish at about 5:10 PM at the Newkirk Plaza and East 16th Street subway station for the "Q" subway train. 

This walk is about 2 1/2 miles.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Only heavy rain will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain, I will post a cancellation notice on Sunday morning. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half of the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.) If I do cancel the art walk, I will post a cancellation notice in the Discussion Board.

Below are photos of one of the beautiful Victorian houses on the tour. We will be visiting this house on the last stop.
results.name: Victorian Flatbush Artist Studio Walk (Oct. 18)

results.description:
Dialogue. It's one thing to write believable (and readable!) dialogue, then you have to go and tag it all up just so the reader has some clue who the heck is talking. We all struggle with finding the right balance between the mundane "he said/she said" and enough descriptive text to make sure we haven't created a bunch of floating heads. For this meetup, we are going to work on this specific skill.

The activity:

A set of lines will be given to each member of the meetup. These lines will be the dialogue. Our job will then be to add the tags, descriptions, quotes, punctuation, etc. in order to make it a readable scene. 

We will take approximately 20 minutes to complete the task.

We then read aloud our pieces.

Note:
For all of our meetups at public establishments it is essential that we show our gratitude for the venue that has agreed to host our meetings by being patrons as we enjoy their space. While there is no fee to attend this meetup, please come prepared to purchase something (even if it is something as small as a bottle of water) from the cafe.
results.name: TAGLESS DIALOGUE Prompt and Read Aloud

results.description:
April Newman

WHAT ARE YOU DOING ON A SUNDAY AFTERNOON? ? ? Come on down (over) (up) to Duet 53. Kick your shoes off and relax. You do not have to sing......The singers love an audience..... I recommend it ...just come.

This is a very nice venue for eating and drinking, laughing , talking, music, and singing. I am told that they call this "box karaoke" because each group gets their own little theater to enjoy  while sitting comfortable on a couch.  We had so much fun at Duet 53 last month, I had to invite us back again. 


The cost is $14 for all afternoon. (between 2:pm and 8:pm). Where else can you and your friends congregate in midtown Manhattan in your own private (air conditioned + you set the temperature, and the volume) room .....all afternoon for $14  dollars??  It is your choice.... whatever music you want to hear....  and,  each song comes with a video.!!!

 YOU CAN BRING YOUR OWN FOOD, BUT NOT DRINKS.    Go online to their website for more details and don't forget to check out their endless song list. (search the sites and you will find the song list).  If you write down the numbers , and bring them with you.......you will not have to search for a song in their books. ...We don't care how good you sing.... we just want some good songs. Let me know if you can come so I can reserve the right size room. 

I will not  wait for YOU in the  lobby area.  If you come after that time, IT IS OK; just tell the staff that you CAME TO JOIN ........  "April and the meetup group".  THEY WILL LET YOU KNOW WHAT ROOM WE ARE IN.  I will reserve the room for 4 hours...from 2:pm until 6:pm

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/60-NYC-young-at-heart/events/224874938/#"></a>
results.name: Socialize, eat, drink,  sing, and listen: I love box karaoke

results.description:
Do you want to read your work at a reading at Readercon?


Do you wish to present your new piece to our writers group?


Great!!


BUT, you might:

- be terrified of reading your material in front of a group

- doubt your choice of material

- want to avoid eye contact with the audience

- think you sound strange when you read

- not know how to use your voice and/or body

- not know how to create a voice for your characters

Join us at the the Art New York South Oxford space with Marcy Arlin.

In this introductory participatory workshop, you will learn:

- how to overcome performance nerves (stage fright)

- choose the right text for a 3 to 10 minute reading

- learn about pacing and rhythm

- learn techniques for voice projection

- practice developing eye contact with audience

- how to use your voice in the best way possible

- how to channel nervousness into a relaxed presentation


Through group, small group and individual exercises, we will do physical and vocal warm-ups, improvisations and theatre games to help you relax and choose the best way for you to present


Please bring two 2-3 minute selections from your work:

It should include dialogue,  narration,  humor, or drama.

Price for this seminar is $10.


Marcy Arlin is a long-time member of BSFW and has been published in Daily Science Fiction, Broad Universe Sampler, PerihelionSF.com, and tcgcircle.com. As Artistic Director of the OBIE-winning Immigrants’ Theatre Project, she has directed over 200 plays. She has taught Public Speaking, Creative Drama, and Acting at CUNY and teaches Theatre for Social Change at Pace University.


Marc has taught acting workshops in the U.S., Romania, Czech Republic, and Slovakia as a Fulbright scholar, and has worked with non-professionals to create theatre from oral histories.


Marcy has read her spec fiction work at the Novel and Short Story workshops at the Center for the Study of Science Fiction, with Kij Johnson, Andy Duncan, and Chris McKitterick; Readercon (open poetry mic, Broad Universe), and the Nuyorican Poets Café with the Immigrants Artists and Scholars.
results.name: How To Read Your Stories for an Audience: A Workshop Presented by Marcy Arlin

results.description:
According to Lawrence Becker in A New Stoicism, to "follow nature" is best construed by a modern Stoic as "to follow the facts." But where do those facts point to?


Becker claims that many facts of human psychology and psychological development point to a path for developing a hyper-developed sense of deliberative choice and action ("agency proper") that maximizes psychological health. 

Becker's argument bears a strong resemblance to the ancient Stoic "oikeiosis" argument. Furthermore, the path that the facts about the cultivation of agency point to bears a strong resemblance to many aspects of ancient Stoicism. Perfection of agency looks in many ways like the classical virtues. And its culmination bears a strong resemblance to sagehood. 

In short, Becker claims that modern day reasoning and facts leads to a new Stoicism.

In this meetup, we'll explore Becker's descriptive argument concerning perfected agency as virtue covered in most of Chapter 6. To prepare, read most, but not all, of Chapter 6  from the beginning up the chapter up to (but not including) the section entitled  "The Argument for Virtue as the Perfection of Agency". Please take note of any passages you'd like to bring up for discussion while you read.

If time permits, we'll also attempt to balance Becker's theory with some practice by discussing practical Stoicism applied to our daily lives.

Below are some focus questions to help guide your reading. Try to answer them as you read. We'll cover some of them during the meetup.

Focus questions

• What were the "hard doctrines of virtue" of the Stoics of antiquity?

• What does virtue consist of in Becker's view?

• Is virtue and "virtuous activity" admitting of degrees

• What's the point of "the cradle argument"? 

• What are "received" and "constructed" elements of agency?

• What are the two main types of received elements of agency?

• How does Becker's ideas of consciousness and agency conflict with ancient Stoicism?

• What is the difference between "endowments" and "developments"? 

• How is our agency constructed? 

• Name the common constructed traits of human personality that Becker outlines.

• Why does Becker claim that emotionality is a constructed trait, not a received one? 

• How does Becker define courage, endurance, and perseverance, and what makes them similar? 

• What's Becker's answer to people who say that Stoic philosophy would lead to passivity? 

• How should  Stoics cultivate their attachments according to Becker? 

• What "integrity projects" do people pursue and why are they important? 

• What is a healthy agency and how does it relate to physical health?

• What is the difference between health, fitness, and virtuosity in relation to agency?

• What's Becker's Stoic Sage like? 

• How is virtue connected to perfected agency?
results.name: A New Stoicism III

results.description:
While the weather is beautiful lets go outdoors for a hike at Garret Mountain Reservation- a hilltop 568-acre park around Lambert Castle, featuring rich bird life and trails with city views. 

The hike should take about 45 mins. to an hour.  One time around the park is about 2 miles- some walking is on a paved road and if we feel adventurous enough we can walk in the woods and by the lake for a short time. Wear good comfortable walking shoes, bring water, and depending on the weather wear appropriate clothing.


We will meet in the parking lot on Park Rd. If you enter the park from Mountain Ave. it is the first parking lot on the left.  There are several parking lots so please look at the map/link below.  We will meet at 2:00 and wait around 20 minutes for everyone to arrive.......

https://www.google.com/maps/@40.90187,-74.1798074,18z 

For those of you who were in the army or boy scouts you can find the parking lot by using your GPS and entering the following coordinates :)  
40°54'03.1"N 74°10'49.7"W
[masked], [masked]

After the hike we will have an early dinner in Montclair....Place to be announced...

I want to say a special thank you to Sandeep for recommending this hike and for providing all the information and description!!  

See you there,

Elana
results.name: Hike @ Garret Mountain Reservation & Dinner in Montclair

If time permits, we'll also attempt to balance Becker's theory with some practice by discussing practical Stoicism applied to our daily lives.

Below are some focus questions to help guide your reading. Try to answer them as you read. We'll cover some of them during the meetup.

Focus questions

• What were the "hard doctrines of virtue" of the Stoics of antiquity?

• What does virtue consist of in Becker's view?

• Is virtue and "virtuous activity" admitting of degrees

• What's the point of "the cradle argument"? 

• What are "received" and "constructed" elements of agency?

• What are the two main types of received elements of agency?

• How does Becker's ideas of consciousness and agency conflict with ancient Stoicism?

• What is the difference between "endowments" and "developments"? 

• How is our agency constructed? 

• Name the common constructed traits of human personality that Becker outlines.

• Why does Becker claim that emotionality is a constructed trait, not a received one? 

• How does Becker define courage, endurance, and perseverance, and what makes them similar? 

• What's Becker's answer to people who say that Stoic philosophy would lead to passivity? 

• How should Stoics cultivate their attachments according to Becker? 

• What "integrity projects" do people pursue and why are they important? 

• What is a healthy agency and how does it relate to physical health?

• What is the difference between health, fitness, and virtuosity in relation to agency?

• What's Becker's Stoic Sage like? 

• How is virtue connected to perfected agency?
results.name: A New Stoicism III

results.description:
I am extremely excited to announce an upcoming group workshops series! This is good for you if you want to work on your songwriting with the support of a group.

The goal of this workshop is to help improve your songwriting and get feedback while feeling supported. We know you probably have a lot going on in your life, so this is a good way to fit songwriting into your schedule.

This workshop runs Sundays starting October 18th 2015 from 2PM to 4PM Eastern Time. The workshop will run five weeks through November 15th. The cost for the 5-week program is $200.

This workshop will take place ONLINE via Google Hangout. So whether you're traveling or you just like sitting at home in your pajamas, this workshop is a convenient way to get feedback from other songwriters and improve your craft!

***Important***

To sign up for this workshop, you MUST register at http://howtowriteasong.org/group-workshop-sign-up/

RSVPing via Meetup will NOT guarantee your spot.


About the songwriting coach:
Nate Mondschein has been composing, performing, recording, writing about and obsessing over music for the better part of 25 years, and plans to continue doing so for as long as he possibly can. As a drummer, producer, session musician and songwriter, Nate performs and records across the northeast with a variety of acts, most notably as a founding member of up and coming NYC IndieSoul sextet, The Rooks. His work spans a vast array of genres, from Motown to Hip-Hop, Indie-Pop to Jazz, Folk to Future-Soul. As an educator, Nate has worked with students of all ages and levels of experience, always emphasizing the importance of an expansive musical vocabulary and refined technique as facilitators of creativity, while utilizing investigations into musical history and canon as means to inspire novel exploration and creation. Nate is also an avid poet and spoken word performer, whose work can be found in a variety of journals.
results.name: Group Songwriting Workshop Series (register at link in descrption)

results.description:
Since the movie based upon the book--starring Matt Damon--comes out in October as well, we're going to make this a two-part meeting. First, if you want to join, we'll be heading to the AMC Loews theater at 312 W 34th St. to see the movie (showtime TBD), and then after we'll walk a few blocks up to our usual spot, the Houndstooth Pub, for discussion of the book and the movie. Then we can really flesh out how the book and the movie compares. 

"The Martian" has become an instant bestseller, topping many favorites lists and nabbing awards. Six days ago, astronaut Mark Watney became one of the first people to walk on Mars. Now, he's sure he'll be the first person to die there. After a dust storm nearly kills him & forces his crew to evacuate while thinking him dead, Mark finds himself stranded & completely alone with no way to even signal Earth that he’s alive—& even if he could get word out, his supplies would be gone long before a rescue could arrive. Chances are, though, he won't have time to starve to death. The damaged machinery, unforgiving environment or plain-old "human error" are much more likely to kill him first. But Mark isn't ready to give up yet. Drawing on his ingenuity, his engineering skills—& a relentless, dogged refusal to quit—he steadfastly confronts one seemingly insurmountable obstacle after the next. Will his resourcefulness be enough to overcome the impossible odds against him?

Update:   AMC has changed their minds, and they will be showing "The Martian" on Sunday after all! The theater has a 10:45 am showing, so we'll be there around 10:30. Hope to see you there! If you can't make the movie, come for the discussion anyway.
results.name: "The Martian", by Andy Weir

results.description:
Join us for October 2015's Book of the Month, "Into the Go Slow" by Bridgett M. Davis. Please come with an open mind, a spirit of fellowship, and a point of view.

As always, I look forward to seeing you there!

Christina

***Book Synopsis***

In 1987 Detroit, twenty-one-year-old Angie passes time working in a mall and watching sitcoms with her mom. But beneath the surface, she is consumed by thoughts of her sister’s death years earlier in Nigeria. Ella had introduced Angie to Black Power and a vision of returning to Africa. On impulse, Angie travels to Lagos and begins to retrace Ella’s steps. Against a backdrop of the city’s infamous go-slow—traffic as wild and unpredictable as a Fela lyric—she uncovers some harsh truths. For anyone who has wished to be of a different era, this book captures the pain of living vicariously and the exhilaration of finding yourself.


***Where to Find the Book***

Amazon

Barnes & Noble

Brooklyn Public Library

Hue-Man Bookstore

New York Public Library

Queens Public Library

The Feminist Press

results.description:
Join us for an afternoon of telling the stories etched into our skins.


Many of us are physically changed. Some by our own design (to commemorate that new found love; to forget that painful break-up; to show the world your allegiance to an author, a musician, a way of thinking, to remind us we are still alive). Some by our own run-in with an accident or mistake (like that time you had the situation with that car window) or an illness. And some by our need to just change.

With these changes come stories. Come show us your life story etched into your skin! Of course you are welcome to simply come to look & listen.

Baring skin & soul.

Greetings, space babes!


We have an upcoming Sci – Fi pin up themed shoot scheduled for Sunday, October 18th! We will be paying tribute to the retro futurism of B movies of the '50s and '60s, bringing bombshells to alien planets and space labs of the ‘future’.  

This shoot is open to anyone interested in modeling, (limited to 3 spots). 


You will receive two images taken on green screen where photographer Kajsa Daphne will drop you in an extra terrestrial landscape. 

You will have access and are able to download all of the images taken at your shoot, and you get to select 5 additional images from our space lab set for editing. You will also receive bonus images from our second shooter.

For $150, you will receive hair styling, two wardrobe looks, and makeup assistance. *As of now we have not booked a makeup artist due to the cost of the body painter.* If there is enough interest we may be able to add that on depending on availability.

You may choose to be body painted for an additional $50. You will need to come to your session earlier as painting takes time! This artist is incredible!!! If you go with paint, due to time limitations, you will be painted in both looks.

You may choose to add on a B movie style poster for an additional $30. This below images is only an example. It will be left entirely to the graphic designer's expertise. This is being outsourced to the same designer that recently did our logo!

Please note the images will not necessarily be done in time for Halloween, as we do not consider this a holiday specific shoot. Please also note payments are non-refundable and non-transferable. 

See you there, space invaders!

Let's All Fight Like A Girl and also honor others who are winning the fight against Cancer and Domestic Violence.  Join us for an afternoon of education, information and pampering. 
October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month and Domestic Violence Awareness Month, two issues that effect women all over the world.  Join us as we honor survivors.


We will have Cheryl Brennen AKA the NJ Bra Lady coming out to provide us with a professional bra fitting.  Did you know that it is estimated that 64% of women are wearing the wrong size bra!!!

We will have Veronica Young RN discussing how to properly conduct self breast examinations and provide educational information.

We will pamper Survivors with a makeover and take their photo. ( please invite a survivor)


Finally, we will recognize all survivors but especially those who are no longer with us and close out by releasing a pink lantern into the sky for them.  Looking forward to seeing you at this meet up!!

Looking for something fun and crazy to do today? Look no further!

Join us for a game of bubble ball soccer in park slope brooklyn (4pm -5pm or 5pm - 6pm). 

In case you don't know what bubble ball soccer is, it's where soccer meets sumo wrestling.

Your goal is to bounce, roll, bump and torpedo into your opponent to prevent them from scoring. Also, there are no fouls ... and your huge plastic bubble ball will mean you won't have to worry about bumps and bruises at the end of the day.
