results.description:
Learn how to ‘tap’ your way to a happier and more fulfilling life using Emotional Freedom Techniques. EFT is a simple yet incredibly effective method of self healing that can be used to immediately reduce anxiety, stress, and other emotions that stand in our way of living in a place of optimum well-being and personal peace. Together we will do lots of EFT tapping to work on individual and collective issues of concern. The more of us who tap together in a group format, the more benefit can be received by all.

At this meetup we will continue exploring the nature of our mind and emotions and learn how to identify ‘stories’ we tell about ourselves that contribute to any sense of personal 'Not-OKness'. Then we can release the charge these stories carry with EFT and increase our personal Emotional Freedom!


One of the special features of our Meetup is that we demonstrate how we have unconscious blocks to happiness and Emotional Freedom. Using Energetic Rescripting Process (ERP), a technique that borrows from Kinesiology and EFT, we locate the nature of these blocks and remove them.


Even from the demos we do in our Meetups people get back to me with remarkable stories of how things in their life are shifting for the better!


Registration for this meeting is requested but not required. There is a nominal $5 charge although a donation of $15-$20 to benefit New Dawn Foundation is suggested.


All are welcome (adults 17 and up who are emotionally comfortable in group settings).

Those new to EFT are asked to join our meetup group to have access to a variety of useful information and resources about EFT (listed under to MORE/FILES tab of this meetup site). Click here to read a primer about using EFT.

You can also find instructional videos and more posted on our new Emotional Freedom Facebook page:
http://www.facebook.com/EFTforEmotionalFreedom


Being already somewhat familiar with EFT will help to minimize our time explaining why we are tapping and saying these strange things, and maximize our time sharing from our personal experiences and using our techniques to release the emotions that no longer serve our well being.
results.how_to_find_us: Its a bit sneaky to find... continue down Davenport ave past the beach clubs and marinas and just past Imperial Yacht club there's a tiny driveway entrance with a sign and mailbox that says New Dawn Foundation... Its the White House by the water.

results.description:
RC58-Version Fun & Games MeetUp!...


Welcome back Fun Gamers!

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games!"... 

Please help us grow!...  please share our group on Google+ & Facebook!

There are "high-res" photos available if you want to print a flyer for work and/or school!

The "Reach-Out" Initiative...

This group is about all of you...  all of you coming to spend time & have fun playing games in a respectful & positive way!  The Super Sundays game night is a very good event, and as such I expect it will continue for quite some time...  but as they say, good is the enemy of great; and I'd like to reach out to all of you to see if we can work together at making the group better.

From the beginning, I've always mentioned that my goal for this group is for it to be self-sufficient and to grow organically from within.  I was very happy that I've been able to step away (and for instance, take a vacation) and be pleasantly surprised that in the "slow" time of the year, you collectively as a group managed to grow our little "extended family".

We have four things we can do to help us "reach-out" and grow in the near future:

• "Reach-Out" to New Sign-Ups


We have new people who sign-up on MeetUp every week.  I used to send a message out to everyone in the beginning, and I think it helped us grow.  However I need help, and I think it'll be more effective if I'm just not the only one.

Here's how I envision it could be a success (so we don't all message the same person, and miss some people):

1 - Post a quick comment in the weekly MeetUp:

     @BigBird - Welcome to our group! :-)

2 - Send the new person a PM:

      BigBird, thanks for joining Fun & Games.  We have a great friendly group of gamers who I now call friends, and I'm hoping to you'll be able to join us soon.  I like the group because of [... ... ...], but we are open to new ideas and doing different things.  What type of games do you like to play?  What type of events do you like to goto?  Take care, and look forward to meeting you.  Your Friendly Neighboorhood Gamer :-)

That's pretty much it...

• "Reach-Out" to Friends & Family, whom you've not seen in the group for a while, or whom are not yet members of the group.  For instance, Jonathan our local magician, often finds himself working on Sundays.  But when I've not seen him in a while, I reach out.  I know he's working, but I let him know he's not forgotten.

Do you have too many friends, and it's hard to schedule to visit them all?...  Then invite them to all come for a Sunday!...  You can get all your friend points for the month.  :-)

In addition, if I'm at Barnes & Noble (maybe in the games section  0:-) I sometimes happen to mention our little group.


• "Reach-Out" to Locations in the Route 4 / Route 17 / US-80 area to help us find a new home (or maybe two "homes", and we rotate bi-weekly.)


Most of you probably already know, but as of 01 January 2016 (or I suppose technically 03 January 2016) we are no longer able to reserve a room at Panera.  It's not so say we can't play there, but we can't commandeer the room and bounce the non-gamers; which I believe will affect the dynamics of the group.

With respect to this, I'm not asking for much; how about just one location each that you think might work?...  PM me for any followup, once you've found out it's available.

• "Reach-Out" for New Events - to do more events like J-Dog's Climbing Day


Arleen asked about whether or not we do things other than gaming on Sundays.  I forgot to mention the Anniversary in the Park Cook-Out; but I did remember J-Dog's climbing day...  But I'd love for others to come up & run with ideas they may have.  I'm not saying we need to do this every week, buy maybe every 4 to 8 weeks?...  what do you all think?

I'll even throw out the first idea...  Let's play billiards.  The event will be "Nine-Ball Ninjas" on Sat evening, 24 October.  I'll post it soon.

Have an idea, please PM me the details...  I'll let you be the organizer for the event, and away we go.  :-)

Thank you...  if you've managed to make it this far, I appreciate it.  If you want to let me know, just say "13" to me at the next MeetUp, and I'll know you took the time.   :-)

Looking forward to seeing you all there!

There will be more 2015 changes/details to come, but I wanted to let you know there's a lot more to come in 2015!!!


Do you want a teaser?...

• We'll start our player / game tracking in 2015!  ...  and at our 2015 Holiday Party, we'll give out awards for various categories!  (It's only about 336 days away, but I wanted to give you time to prepare...  :-P)


Thanks & hope to see you there!

George

a.k.a. Jorge Loco

PS RSVP isn't required, but it'll definitely help me out!

PPS Shall we play a game?

http://www.meetup.com/Fun-And-Games-Meetup-Tenafly-Northern-New-Jersey-NJ/messages/boards/thread/48695815/

results.description:
Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 4:30PM to 5PM, then we begin the show at 5 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 7:30PM.


This week we have:


Episode 7 "You Win or You Die"

Episode 8 "The Pointy End"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.


This is a NEWBIE friendly event so our usual rules do not apply. Please no spoilers about the show or books in this newbie friendly environment (including this comment section). Anything already watched by the group as part of the Countdown is fair game to discuss by all, but no discussing the resolutions of things in the presence of our newbies. (Maesters will have their own anything goes events and time after the show). Newbies are of course welcome to theorize and forecast, but those of us who actually know "shall not pass" the information!

This week we will be meeting at Stone Creek which has a great menu of affordable eats. (Next week we will most likely continue at Valerian Steel). For the past several years Stone Creek has been home to the coolest Game of Thrones watching parties during the GOT seasons. As we get closer to the season premier we will be at Stone Creek more and more so we can smoothly transition into "in-season" mode.
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 1 Episodes 7 & 8

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

This is a hands-on baking class where Antonella (Krumville founder) will be teaching us how to make gluten free pies and tarts – perfect for the upcoming holiday season. And while the pies are in the oven why not take that time to have a glass of wine and learn more about Krumville Bake Shop!

Cost: $47 per person

You must purchase tickets using this link: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/gluten-free-pie-tart-baking-class-tickets-18812957061#

Krumville Bake Shop


630 Flushing Avenue, Fl 8

Brooklyn, NY 11206   

Directions:Nearest Subways M and G to Flushing Avenue Exit.The entrance to the building is trough the back parking lot on Tompkins Ave, right off Flushing ave. 

FAQs

Will we be able to bring home what we bake?

Of course! We will share slices of all the pies and tarts we'll make. In addition you'll receive a free bag of flour mix with a recipe for your next pie project.

Is your facility glutenfree?

Yes our kitchen is 100% gluten-free.

Do you process Nuts and Dairy?

Yes, we process nuts and dairy regurarly.

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

Unfortunately we are not fitted to ensure safety in our kitchen for children under the age of 16. No ID needed.

 What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Our building offers free parking, just let the security guard know you are coming to Krumville Bake Shop.

The entrance to the parking lot is though Tompkins Ave, right off Flushing Ave.

What to wear?

Please wear comfortable, casual clothing and flat, comfortable shoes. Keep in mind this is a commercial kitchen setting and you will operate hot ovens and mixers so NO open-toed shoes or sandals should be worn, as you will be baking in a FDA regulated production facility. If your hair is longer than your ears length, you must pull your hair back in a elastic band, we will provide each of you with an apron and tools.

 Is my registration/ticket transferrable?

Of course! please email us to arrange the transfer at [masked]

Note: We need a minimum number of 10 people for this event to happen, so we encourage you to sign up with a friend or two! In the event that we do not meet 10 people the event will  be cancelled and refunds will be given.

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Is anyone else a bit burned out on Malbec?

Not that there’s anything wrong with Argentine Malbec.  It’s a reliably fruity, soft-tannin red that is often the safest and most reasonably priced choice on a by-the-glass list.  But I find it’s rarely very interesting or exciting, especially when bottled as an unblended varietal wine (I find the best Malbecs are the ones in which other grapes are blended in, adding an extra dimension). 

But you have to admire Argentina for turning this relatively obscure grape, long in decline in its native France, into a household name and big moneymaker.  It was once popular in Bordeaux, and is the primary grape of the southwestern French appellation Cahors, where, when grown on rugged limestone slopes, it achieves true distinction (with a rustic goût de terroir that actually makes it one of my favorite French wines).  But its proneness to rot and disease has made it fall into disfavor in France, while the warmer, drier climate of Argentina has allowed the grape to thrive. 

Argentina has marketed its Malbec so successfully that many makers of Cahors have taken to labeling their wines with the grape name (almost unheard-of for a French AOC wine), in order to cash in on Malbec’s new popularity.  (I’d personally prefer to see Argentine Malbecs give credit to their origin, with labels saying “Same grape as Cahors!”)

So I thought it would be interesting to put together a tasting of Argentine wines that avoids that cash-cow Malbec (or includes it in blends as a minority component).  What else can Argentina do well?

We have a lineup of seven wines:

—A Chardonnay by Catena Zapata, one of Argentina’s pioneer winemakers (founded 1902), making some of the country’s most prestigious wines.

 —A Pinot Noir by Bodega Chacra, a biodynamic producer making wines from ungrafted 80-year-old vines in the severe climate of Patagonia.

—A Syrah by Luca, an offshoot of the Catena brand, making Syrah from Rhône vines planted over 50 years ago by viticulturist Luis Laborde. 

—A Cabernet Franc and a Bonarda (Argentina’s other signature grape) made by another Catena offshoot, El Enemigo, founded by Adrianna Catena (Nicolas Catena’s daughter) and Alejandro Vigil, the longtime chief winemaker at Catena.  El Enemigo’s 2011 single-vineyard Gualtallary wine achieved the highest rating (98 points) ever given to an all–Cabernet Franc wine by the Wine Advocate.  The winery’s name means “the enemy,” which is explained on their website: “At the end of the journey, we remember only one battle. The one we fought against ourselves, the original enemy. The one that defined us.”  (OK, Alejandro, whatever you say . . .)

—A Cabernet Sauvignon by old-school artisanal winemaker Carmelo Patti, who came to Argentina from Sicily at age 1.  It’s a single-vineyard wine, unfined and unfiltered, aged in neutral oak for 12 months, and then held in bottle at the winery until Carmelo decided it was ready.  This 2006 wine is the current release.  Even the label is old-school—it looks like an Inglenook label from the ‘60s. 

—A blend of Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Petit Verdot from prestigious boutique winery Achaval Ferrer.  It’s a young (founded 1999), modern winery whose single-vineyard bottlings have achieved cult status.  The Quimera is their take on a Bordeaux blend, and it shows Malbec’s potential when it is supported by other grape varieties.

We’ll be meeting for an early Sunday dinner at Piccola Trattoria, a very good Argentine-owned Italian restaurant in Dobbs Ferry that kindly agreed to host us.  The rustic decor includes a perfect table for ten in the middle of the dining room.


http://piccolany.com/

2012 Bodegas Catena Zapata Catena Alta Chardonnay (Valle de Uco, Mendoza)  $27

Wine Advocate 91 – The 2012 Catena Alta Chardonnay is sourced from two separate vineyards in different villages of the Valle de Uco, Adrianna in Gualtallary, and Domingo in Villa Bastias. The clear must ferments slowly in 500-liter oak barrels so it becomes quite stable naturally. It matured in those oak barrels for 14-15 months. It has a Burgundian nose, with subtle oak and orange peel, hints of pollen, and beeswax. The palate is very fresh, the grapes were harvested quite early to keep the acidity. The wine ends quite austere. Only part of it went through malolactic fermentation.

2013 Chacra Cincuenta y Cinco Pinot Noir (Rio Negro, Patagonia)  $40

Wine Advocate 94 – A very elegant, subtle wine that is light-colored and has floral (roses, lilies) notes alongside wild strawberries and raspberries. It feels light but has very good concentration of flavors and enough clout, while keeping the poise. The tannins feel very refined, there is good freshness and acidity. It should have a very nice evolution in bottle. This would be the proverbial iron fist in a velvet glove. Bravo!

2011 Luca Laborde Double Select Syrah (La Consulta, Mendoza)  $26

Tanzer 91 – Good full, deep red-ruby.  Dark berries, kirsch, blackberry, dark chocolate, mocha and smoked meat on the nose, plus a whiff of leather.  Sweet, lush, pliant and full, with a strong chocolatey ripeness to the intense dark berry flavors.  Chewy, mouthfilling Syrah from 50-year-old vines (the vine cuttings originally came from the northern and southern Rhone Valley).  Finishes big and broad, with furry tannins and a hint of game.

2011 Bodega Aleanna El Enemigo Cabernet Franc (Valle de Uco, Mendoza)  $23

Tanzer 90 – Dark ruby-red.  Lovely violet lift to the aromas of cassis, blackberry, black olive, and licorice.  Fresh and aromatic in the mouth, with noteworthy verve to the flavors of sour cherry, flowers, spices, licorice, and mint.  Finishes long and lively, with firm but smooth tannins.  Carrying a moderate 13.9% alcohol and already long on personality.  92% Cabernet Franc, 8% Malbec.

Wine Advocate 92 -- Austere, lineal and straight with very high acidity. It is very much about the soil, not much about the fruit, but its youth is revealed in the notes of the elevage that are still there: that is cedar wood, peat and graphite. Summarizing, this is an austere, serious, long, tight red that has great potential to age. Drink 2015-2020.

2011 Bodega Aleanna El Enemigo Bonarda (Valle de Uco, Mendoza)  $27

Wine Spectator 90 – Ripe, rich, and intense, with impressive concentration to the raspberry, dark plum, and kirsch flavors. Very svelte, delivering luscious licorice and spice notes, which linger on the finish with baker's chocolate details.

2006 Carmelo Patti Cabernet Sauvignon (Lujan de Cuyo, Mendoza)  $32

Wine Advocate 93 – The 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon from Perdriel shows orange tints denoting its age. Carmelo Patti likes to release his wines after a long aging in the winery, when he thinks they are ready to drink. There are plenty of aromas of tea leaves, paprika, hints of leather and cured meat plus dried flowers and something earthy. The austere palate shows fully resolved tannins. There is nothing lush about this wine. This superb classically styled Cabernet is tasty, long, and ready to drink. If you want to see what Cabernet can do in Argentina this is a good example. This is like time-traveling.

2011 Achaval Ferrer Quimera (Mendoza)  $36

Wine Spectator 92 – This dark, compact red leads with a floral note to the racy cassis and cherry puree fruit, well-integrated with fine tannins and bright acidity. Offers a long finish of fruit, mineral, and tobacco. 38% Malbec, 26% Cabernet Franc, 23% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, and 3% Petit Verdot.

Tanzer 89+? -- Good medium ruby.  High-pitched aromas of blackberry, blueberry and licorice.  Concentrated, juicy and tightly wound, with a slightly high-toned character to the flavors of crushed blackberry, minerals, licorice, and bitter chocolate.  Almost tart today, this firm, vibrant, very young wine needs time in bottle and may ultimately merit an outstanding rating.
results.name: Argentina ABM (Anything But Malbec)

results.description:
Getting into our Right Mind: The Practice of Meditation
with Alex Bonano

At the moment, we do not recognize the vast potential of the mind.  We relate to a mind that feels stuck in negativity, and we experience the world as a place of problems and suffering that we can do little to change. But when we experience our mind directly we discover that it has a limitless potential, and is capable of limitless love, wisdom and joy. By going deep into the heart and connecting to the limitless potential of the mind, we will discover we have the power to free ourselves from negativity, and to change our experience of the world.Sept 13:    The Wonders of the Mind


Sept 20:  The Peaceful Nature of the Mind
Sept 27:   Limitless Mind, Limitless Potential
Oct 4:       Getting into the Heart 

Weekly guided meditations and Buddhist teachings in Astoria are suitable for both beginners and more advanced meditation practitioners.  These classes offer meditation techniques and teachings on the fundamentals of Buddhism, with an emphasis on their practical application in everyday life.

Although these meditation classes are given as a series, they can also be taken individually. Please feel free to drop in on a class-by-class basis.

Classes are held every week unless otherwise stated.
No special clothing is required. No pre-registration required.

5:30 – 7:00 pm
$10 | Free for Supporting Members

Location:

Grace Lutheran Church

results.description:
Sanderson Jones, co-founder of Sunday Assembly, has suggested that assemblers could visit churches and similar groups to see what good things they’re doing that we might want to do ourselves. Also, it’s a great way for us to build bridges. In that spirit, we’re trying out a news series of outings to churches, starting with St. Lydia’s in Brooklyn.

If “St. Lydia’s” makes you think of a Gothic cathedral and incense, you’re way off. This contemporary, progressive congregation is a ‘Dinner Church.’ That’s right, their services consist primarily of getting together and eating! They define being a ‘progressive’ church for themselves as follows:

"It means that we approach the bible both spiritually and intellectually, we embrace sexuality and all sexual orientations, and we affirm the spiritual journeys of those of other faiths."

As for whether non-Christians and atheists are welcome:

"If you’re not sure what you believe, rest assured that neither are we. We place practice before belief, trusting that the practice of eating, praying, and singing together that moves us deeper into faith. Instead of trying to figure out what we believe, we’re trying to live what we practice."

For more, check out their website [http://stlydias.org/]. Even better, GO WITH US to hang out with these Christians for an evening.

NOTE: It would be great if everyone could chip in a little offering, since we'll be eating with them. If you prefer, they also welcome people bringing "dessert or a bunch of flowers," asking that desserts be the kind that don't require utensils (cookies, brownies, etc). Also, NO ALCOHOL. :-)
results.name: Sunday Assembly Goes to Church - October 2015 Edition - St. Lydia’s

A $5 *DEPOSIT* is required to RSVP, which will be *REFUNDED* *IN* *CASH* 10 minutes after the event starts.  No-shows and latecomers forfeit their deposit.  You will receive an electronic refund if you change your RSVP to "No" more than 24 hours before the event.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

The age of driverless cars is fast approaching us.  The ethics of the robot drivers has to be programmed.  Should your car decide to drive you off a cliff, sacrificing your life, to save the lives of a bunch of school children in your path who you were about to overrun?

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

The American university system is severely broken.  Costs have run out of control, and there is a lack of effort being made to find out which universities are doing the best job of teaching. 

This article lists many of the problems of our universities, and reasons why they're not being fixed.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

This article discusses the Citizens United Supreme Court decision, which decided two things:

• Corporations (and unions) are people, and thus have a right to free speech.

• Political spending is a form of speech.

results.description:
Join artists, activists, and educators to discuss issues of ethnic heritage, community, identity, and political self-determination and the role of art in both the creation and disruption of communities.


Moderator: Pennee Bender (American Social History Project, CUNY)

Panelists: Ozan Aksoy (Ethnomusicologist, NYU), Dean Moss (Interdisciplinary Artist, Gametophyte Inc.), Judy Pryor-Ramirez (Director of Civic Engagement & Social Justice, The New School), Betty Yu (Artist, U.S. Department of Arts & Culture), Maritza Arrastia (Educator, Turning Point)

Artist Savas Boyraz’s current exhibit at Open Source Gallery, "Back Drop," looks at Kurdish ethnic identity and community and the ways it has been disrupted by borders, wars, and government policies. His work seeks to reunite Kurdish identity and document current Kurdish experiences and communities. 

This panel discussion will draw on the themes in Boyraz’s work to explore issues around ethnic heritage, community, identity, and political self-determination and the ways art can contribute to the creation of community or how art suffers as communities are disrupted or destroyed. While most of us acknowledge the need for community and desire greater connections through our communities, the term is inherently vague and as there as many ways to identify community as there are forms of identity – ethnicity, race, class, gender, sexual preferences, professions, neighborhoods, social or political interests, sports, and the list can go on and on. What are the advantages or disadvantages of the multiplicity of identities and communities in a city like New York/Brooklyn? How can these overlapping communities serve the social and political needs of the 99% or 99.9% in the face of popular media that often represents the interests of the 1%. And finally what is the role of artists and art work in creating, sustaining, and uniting communities or how is creativity impacted when artist-friendly communities are not sustained.
results.name: Panel Discussion: Ethnicity/Community/Identity/Art

For almost 30 years, this family owned and operated French bistro has been serving the Upper West Side and Lincoln Center theater goers with classic French dishes. Zagat 22, La Boite en Bois is a quaint and romantic French restaurant in the heart of the Upper West Side. Just off of Columbus Avenue, it is tucked away downstairs in a beautiful brownstone. With its rustic ambience, you will feel as though you are in the countryside of France. La Boîte en Bois certainly lives up to its name, which implies cozy rusticity. The menu includes, but is not limited to: smoked salmon and smoked trout with a cucumber dill salad, roasted salmon with cous cous and spinach, homemade pasta of the day, chicken with mushroom sauce, beef bourguignon, ending with a medley of French desserts.

This Sunday we'll look at specific topics and passages that false teachers use to pursue their own self-interest.  Let's learn to be Bereans as in Acts 17 where they sought the Scriptures to check and make sure what the Apostle Paul said about Jesus being the Messiah, was in fact true. 


ABOUT US 

Welcome! Brooklyn Ark (Manhattan Campus) is an exciting church that meets on Wall Street in Lower Manhattan. If you are looking for a church, a community to make and meet friends, or a space to wrestle with the deep questions of life, this is a perfect place for you.


WHEN WE MEET
Sunday Morning Service at 11:00am starting Sunday, November 1st with after-party networking
Sunday Evening Service at 6:30pm with after-party networking
Get connected at the many mid-week Bible studies and community events throughout the week.


WHERE WE MEET
48 Wall Street, Manhattan (5th Floor), NY (Financial District Downtown NYC)
Take any of these convenient lines: 2/3, J/Z, and 4/5. A few blocks further you'll find the 1, R, A/C, and PATH at World Trade Center. You'll also find the Staten Island Ferry Whitehall Terminal to be a 10-minute walk away. 

WHAT TO EXPECT
On Sunday evenings an amazing crowd gathers for music, food, networking, a thought-provoking lecture, and riveting discussion. Our other midweek and weekend events are fun and diverse, and they include: skydiving trips, house parties, hiking trips, relationship workshops, Bible studies, racial unity and reconciliation seminars, community banquets for homeless families, cage diving with sharks, international travel vacations, and much more. Check out our Event Photos page.


NEXT STEPS
Join us for our Sunday Morning Gathering at 11:00am starting November 1st, our Sunday Evening Gathering at 6:30pm, or the Wednesday night Bible Scholar Series at 7:00pm. Let us know if it's your first time visiting. We look forward to meeting you introducing you to a fantastic group of people.

results.description:
"Synergy" is an abstract concept that refers to a result that arises from interacting processes. The term synergy comes from the Attic Greek word synergos, meaning "working together". That is the word I would like to recommend when describing the amazing impression that modern art and live jazz music can create together.

Hello, everyone!

I am very happy to organize 'Autumn in New York, modern art meets jazz & wine' social for our members at a very beautiful and unique art venue, La Maison d'Art (2014 Winner of Certificate of Excellence by tripadvisor).

Please see the below details for further information.

Venue; La Maison d'Art:

La Maison d'Art is the stylish and contemporary artistic place to be in New York City. From the  moment you enter the gallery, you will be immersed in an authentic New York moment in such an intimate, personal and relaxed environment. Filled with original, provocative paintings and sculptures created by rising local and international artists, La Maison d'Art will make you fall in love with art with its unique balance of talent and combination of style. Please see the following review for your reference: http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60763-d1600107-Reviews-La_Maison_d_Art-New_York_City_New_York.html

Quintet Concert (2 sets)/ Jazz Artists: 


I am very happy to invite one of the finest jazz drummers in the world, Jochen Rueckert from Germany in the band for this event: http://www.theguardian.com/music/2014/oct/09/jochen-rueckert-we-make-the-rules-review

• Trumpet & Trombone: Nick Vayenas (Michael Buble's Band) www.nickvayenas.com

• Saxophone: Patrick Cornelius http://www.patrickcornelius.com

• Bass: Rick Rosato (from Montreal, Canada) http://nextbop.com/blog/therickrosatoquintet


• Piano: Assen Doykin (from Bulgaria) http://www.doykinmusic.com


These elite jazz musicians will perform a beautiful autumn themed jazz standard such as 'Autumn in New York' and their own creative compositions. Please see the following youtube clip to check out Chet Baker's version of 'Autumn in New York': 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KBWiq88UuPk

Autumn Wine & Cupcake Social:

Wines for fall: Gewürztraminer Alsace and Cabernet Sauvignon

Gewurztraminer (ga-VERTZ-trah-mee-ner) originated in the Traminer region of Germany a thousand years ago. Originally known as Traminer (and you will still find wines labeled as such), the word Gewürz (spice) was later added to its name in recognition of the extraordinary aromatic qualities of the wine. Aromas and flavors often described as honey, pumpkin spice, cinnamon, apricot, pear and rose seem perfectly suited to an autumn evening. Before we delve into the full-bodied reds and our sweater drawer, there’s still time to enjoy this unusual and versatile white.


Organic Pumpkin Cupcakes.

Meet equally nice people who love culture, art, jazz and wine in NYC!

Cost: 


Price (Final) is $20.00 and payment will be accepted via online only. No funds will be accepted at the door. You can pay directly via Meetup or via Paypal-->[masked] OR this ticket link: TICKET.  It will normally cost us $15.00-$20.00 for a jazz club admission in the city, $15.00 for a private gallery admission and extra $13.00 for a glass of good wine at a bar, $3.00 for an organic cupcake so please take advantage of this bargain opportunity!! 

PRICE INCLUDES:

Admission to La mason d'art's private art gallery, lounge and their candle lit sculpture garden for 2 hours, seat (first come, first serve), 2 sets of live jazz concerts, autumn wine and cupcake reception

How to get to La Maison d'art:

This colorful art house is less than 3 blocks from St. Nicholas Park and a 9-minute walk to the Apollo Theatre. 2 blocks from 135st (Line 2,3 OR Line A,B,C). Please click here for the map--->DIRECTION

See you guys soon, 

Angie.

P.S. I strongly recommend that you bring your camera or a cell phone with a camera to capture a memory at such a beautiful place. Don't forget to check out their amazing candle lit sculpture garden while sipping the wine of your choice ;) 

Here are more pictures of true New York quality times at La Maison d'art:

results.description:
WE TELL STORIES (and drink sangria specials!) at this FREE event at New World Stages!!!!

In addition to hearing from a handful of curated special guest writers/performers at each event, this is also an opportunity for you to tell a story from your travels off the cuff or bring in a prepared essay, journal entry, blog, video, poem, song, or even a piece of fiction that you created about/while traveling--domestically, internationally, or even from one side of the city to the other! (At least four to five story-tellers will be pulled from a hat so, if you're interested, be sure to sign up when our host passes around the hat!)

Even if you don't share a story, come listen, reunite, and hug us!!!! It's been too long! If we've never met, then it's REALLY been too long; introduce yourself!


Host:

Mike Axelrod

Headliner:

Katie Halper (Jezabel, MSNBC, Huffpostive)


Featured Performers/Writers:


Kathleen Amshoff

Jonathan David

Glenna Grant


Annie Hartkemeyer


Maoly Hernandez


Aneeta Iqbal


Sanjana Nair


Sam Tapia

WHAT SHOULD I EXPECT?

Travelogue is a free event -- hosted by the lovely Mike Axelrod--filled with creative travelers, supportive friends, and fun performances. All Travelogue storytellers will receive a complimentary T-shirt in appreciation for sharing.

DID WE MENTION THAT THE EVENT IS FREE AND THAT THERE ARE DRINK SPECIALS!

WHEN AND WHERE?

Sunday 10/18, 7:15-9:30 New World Stages, downstairs in the Time Out New York Lounge. (340 West 50th St.)


QUESTIONS?

Visit

www.dramaticadventure.com


and/or


Email [masked]

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.
results.name: Sunday Night Meditation

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633153420</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125361<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event at 8pm.

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Friday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced


Please RSVP only if you are 100% sure you can make it.  When you RSVP, you are holding a spot for a meetup that has high demand.  No refunds will be issued if you decide to cancel.  

Only players on the ACTIVE list will be allowed to play (No Exceptions).  If you must cancel, allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list. 


RULES:

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay)

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

results.description:
How signing up works: First come first serve.

The Place:

Somtum Der was recently awarded one Michelin star, but it's not very expensive.


Established in 2012 in the heart of Bangkok's bustling Sala Daeng district, Somtum Der brought authentic, yet contemporary, Isan (Northeastern Thai) cuisine to Bangkokians who had grown accustomed to traditional Thai food that had over time become "watered down" to suit Western tastes. In just 18 months Somtum Der Bangkok has been warmly embraced by locals, expatriates and tourists. Somtum Der has now ventured into the United States and curious palates of New York City, presenting a unique opportunity for New Yorkers to encounter and enjoy authentic Isan food.

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.name: Chris Cornell

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Ok folks, it's the third Sunday of the month, again- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.
results.name: Cards Against Humanity

Okay we have a special treat for this sunday for Meetup, Complimentary tickets for the 10pm show, please come early to get a seat. The Line up includes Greer Barnes (In living Color, Comedy Central), Godfrey, Phil Hanley (Tonight Show), Chris DiStefano (MTV Guy Code).

For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Its a 2 drink, minimum as in any comedy club. Try to be early the show starts at 10 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

venue.address_1: Guide will meet you at Poughkeepsie Train Station
venue.name: take the 9:48am Metro North Train from Grand Central to Poughkeepsie

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


Enjoy the "Million Dollar View" of the Catskills as the leaves change. Reminders of its earlier agricultural roots, the open fields and broad views at Spring Farm give way to quiet, forested paths in the famous Gunks Mountain range near New Paltz, NY. Enjoy an invigorating fall  day out of the city with other fun members of our group as you will be treated to some of the most breathtaking views of the Hudson Valley.

Your day will begin with the breathtaking train ride from Grand Central along the Hudson River.  The concrete and congestion of the city will melt away to rolling hills and dazzling river views.  Your guide/host will meet you at Poughkeepsie train station (the last stop) and wisk you off to a mountain range where you will spend about 2 1/2 hours hiking with a stop along the way to enjoy lunch overlooking the valley. After the hike we will visit a local winery and The Walkway over the Hudson Park. This hike includes a moderate rock scramble (climbing on boulders) it is suggested for those who are in fairly good shape.  Your guide will be with you every step of the way to ensure you are comfortable and safe. (this is not like climbing with ropes)

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

To register please go directly to www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

$65  includes:  round trip transportation from train station to all attractions, hiking, all hiking fees.taxes and tips. You can also opt to drive to meet the group in Poughkeepsie.

What is not included: since not all will be drinking, winery tasting fee's (usually $5-$8per person), lunch. Train.

What to bring: Hiking shoes or sneakers with hard soles and good treads, sunblock, bottled water, bag lunch.

What to expect: 15 fun and friendly people who love the outdoors.

Hiking level: Moderate + The rock scramble would be a 6 out of 10 difficulty. The scramble is about 20 minutes out of the hike.

Can I come alone? Yes , 98% of those attending will be signing up on their own.

Refunds given only if hike is canceled due to rain.

You will be brought to the 5:54 train back to NYC

If you do not see a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be many people attending from other groups, YOU WILL NOT BE ALONE!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Hudson Valley Hike/Rock Scramble, Pumpkin & Apple Picking + Winery Day Trip

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

This energy is fabulous for losing weight, relaxing, balancing, and working on the adrenal glands, and all of the organs and glands, and can help with appetite and cravings, and also sleep, which is so good for your health and for your weight!

You can do this from your own favorite spot, either your bed, couch, floor, chair, or wherever.

All you need to do is nothing!

You can set an intention to receive the energies, sent by Jae, and if you want to you can ask for a wish, and ask for something you want to release.

I usually ask to release something I'm craving that's not healthy for me, and it usually works.

If you think this is something you want to try, then please RSVP, and I will send you the energies, and answer any questions you may have.

Good nutrition is the core to weight loss and good health, along with exercise, and good

Energy Nutrition is important as well.

Hope to see you at the next Challenge!

Hope you'll join me tonight!

All the very best,

Jae (Enerjae)

results.description:
Zum zweiten Mal in Folge bereist der Bundesverband Deutsche Startups e.V. die Startup Hochburg der Ostküste der U.S.A.: es geht nach New York City!


GEHT MIT UNS AUF REISEN: German NYC Week 2015

Wir nehmen rund 40 Startup Unternehmer, Vertreter aus Politik und Wirtschaft mit und schnuppern vom 19. – 23. Oktober 2015 eine Woche aufregende Startup Luft in Manhattan. Kommt mit uns mit, wenn wir die innovativsten Geschäftsmodelle kennenlernen und uns mit erfolgreichen Entrepreneuren des östlichen Silicon Valleys austauschen. 

Hier geht es zur Anmeldung! 

„Am besten gefallen hat mir die Zusammenstellung der Teilnehmer. Die unterschiedlichsten Branchen, Geschäftsmodelle und nicht zuletzt unterschiedlichsten Leute haben für mich den besonderen Wert der Reise ausgemacht. Hier sind Freundschaften fürs Leben entstanden und gefestigt worden. Für mich Klassenreise 3.0.“ - Julia Derndinger , Unternehmerin und Gründertrainerin

Wie sieht die Agenda unserer diesjährigen Reise aus?

Mo. 19. Oktober 2015

Nach der individuellen Anreise empfangen wir euch im Hotel. Nach dem Check-In habt ihr noch einmal Zeit euch frisch zu machen. Wer mit dem Jetlag keine Probleme hat ist am Abend herzlich willkommen zum unofficial get together.

Di. 20. Oktober 2015

Bei unserem opening breakfast lernen sich nicht nur die Teilnehmer untereinander kennen, auch Gäste aus der Szene werden einige Insides geben. Im Anschluss wird der Tag ganz den Side Visits gewidmet. Am Abend lassen wir dann die ersten Eindrücke bei einem Networking Event sacken.

Mi. 21. Oktober 2015

Bei einem gemeinsamen Frühstück erfahren wir z.B. was man bei einem Markteintritt alles beachten muss. Side Visits, Site Visits, Site Visits…ein Office ist spannender als das nächste. Am Abend dann wieder reger Austausch mit Entrepreneuren, Multiplikatoren, und Playern des US-Ecosystems in lockerer Atmosphäre.

Do. 22. Oktober 2015

Heute gibt es zum Frühstückskaffee einen Löffel voll Wissens- und Erfahrungsaustausch dazu. Tagsüber sind wir wieder dabei die Szene hautnah an ihrem Arbeitsplatz kennen zu lernen. Der letzte Abend um sich noch mal richtig tief in Gespräche zu verwickeln über die Unterschiede zwischen dem Deutschen- und dem US-Markt.

Fr. 23. Oktober 2015

Nach unserem letzten gemeinsamen Frühstück müssen wir leider auschecken. Jeder Teilnehmer tritt dann seine Heim- oder vielleicht auch Weiterreise an.

Das Programm befindet sich derzeit noch in der beta-Phase.

Alle Reisen des BVDS findet Ihr auf www.deutschestartups.org/reisen/
results.name: German NYC Week 2015

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is On The Shelf.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - On The Shelf

Partner Event (You must register on the website listed):

NCMA Picatinny Chapter 2015 Small Business Symposium

Discounted Registration Link: CLSBS20 ($20 off registration)

How will you benefit from attending this event?

1.     Invaluable networking opportunities with Government, Industry, and Academia.

2.     Gain a piece of the $90+ Billion Small Business Federal Marketplace.

3.     Learn firsthand from Government Contracting Officials, Program Managers, Legal Representatives, and successful Small Business owners.

4.     Learn about Other Transaction Agreements (OTA) from experts at the forefront of this innovative contracting method.


What are the significant advantages of Other Transaction Agreements (OTA)?

1.     Cost-effective engagement with Government buyers.

2.     Relief from FAR and supplemental regulations to spur innovation.

3.     A collaborative approach to developing Government requirements.

4.     Faster time to project award.

5.     Join the rapidly growing Defense Technology Innovation Base working under OTAs.


Examples of technology being transitioned under OTAs:

Robotics, Communications, Energy Technologies, Environmental Science, Software Development, Aerospace, Materials Science, Energetics, Information Systems, Manufacturing Sciences, Security, Command and Control, Prototype Fabrication, System Integration, Testing and Evaluation, Autonomy, Survivability, and More.


Discounted Registration Link: 

CLSBS20

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.name: Send us your latest house set to contribute to our weekly radio show!

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

results.description:
1524 is an online 24-hour shoot-off photography competition brought to you by Adorama & Visual Media One.  The event is based on one theme picked after keynote presentation by internationally acclaimed photographer Joe McNally on Monday October 19th.  A live stream of the keynote presentation and event launch will be available starting at 3pm when event starts here (See URL below). For those in the city who would like to watch in person, drop by Adorama at 42 W 18th St, New York, NY 10011.  Participants will turn in between (3) to (5) image entries by next day’s deadline and judged for its storytelling or essay capability relative to the picked theme.  Winners are judged for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place.  All images entered are then judged for best single photo that depicts the same theme.  This is an online competition streamed live, critique for all submissions will be available for live viewing on October 21st, from 12 PM noon here  (See URL below).  Deadline is Eastern Standard Time on Tuesday 5pm October 20th.  Judging starts at 12 PM noon on Wednesday on the third and final day and is open to the public.

Adorama and Visual Media One have teamed up to provide you with an exciting photographic challenge no matter where you are in the world during the week of PhotoPlus Expo in New York City.  1524 stands for ‘one theme’ entering up to ‘five images’ and photographed ‘within twenty four hours.

BY ENTERING THE COMPETITION - entrant agrees to competition terms and conditions as stated in the Rules section of the 1524 website: http://visualmediaone.com/1524/Rules.html

October 19th live stream URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ePojN1JQECA

October 21st live stream URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T4qmtOc8oO4

Visit the 1524 website for more information: http://visualmediaone.com/1524/Welcome.html
results.name: 1524: 24 Hour Shoot Off Photo Competition

results.description:
IMPORTANT: You must register to access the training (your RSVP is not enough) https://theatreaid.leadpages.co/crowdfunding-training/
This is also where you can choose your time slot.

How to create a successful crowdfunding VIDEO is for:

Writers, performers, musicians, fine artists and any other creative beings who are curious about crowdfunding and want to know how to use it to help you create your art work.

Learn how to create a rocking crowdfunding video that will take you less time to make and will bring you more money into your campaign.

Learn what the 6 most common mistakes artists tend to make with their crowdfunding videos.

Hi, I'm Tal Jakubowiczova and I specialise in supporting artists’ crowdfunding campaigns to success.
There is quite a lot of advice about crowdfunding for businesses, but not much for creatives, and the unique funding challenges we face - even though it was creatives who started crowdfunding as we know it!
So this webinar is all about crowdfunding creative style!

In this 2 hour session we'll cover:

• What other 2 major things you can get from crowdfunding (apart for cash)

• The main reason people will give money to your project

• What the worst mistakes you can make when creating a crowdfunding video are...and how to avoid them

• Plus much more info you need to know to start your successful crowdfunding adventure

• I will also be answering your individual crowdfunding questions.

Please message me below with any questions.
Hope to see many of you there.

Please register here to get your unique access link to our virtual training room.
https://theatreaid.leadpages.co/crowdfunding-training/

Keep creative,
Tal

results.description:
Last time was so much fun, were doing it again and we've got VIP TIX!

We have a block of 30 tickets for our group to see a live taping of the Comedy Central show The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore. Continuing in Comedy Central’s grand tradition of producing groundbreaking late night formats, “The Nightly Show” highlight's Larry Wilmore’s distinct point of view and comedic take on current events and pop culture. Hosted by Wilmore, the show features a diverse panel of voices, providing a perspective largely missing in the late night television landscape.

PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:30PM.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own. Each person will have the opportunity to invite a guest. If you wish to bring more people (up to 4 you must guarantee that they will all come)

How should I dress? business casual

How long does it last? We will be out of the taping by 7/7:30pm if not earlier.  Following the taping the group will go to a nearby pub for food and drink.

Continuing in Comedy Central’s grand tradition of producing groundbreaking late night formats, “The Nightly Show” highlight's Larry Wilmore’s distinct point of view and comedic take on current events and pop culture. Hosted by Wilmore, the show features a diverse panel of voices, providing a perspective largely missing in the late night television landscape.

PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:30PM.


Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own. Each person will have the opportunity to invite a guest. If you wish to bring more people (up to 4 you must guarantee that they will all come)

How should I dress? business casual

How long does it last? We will be out of the taping by 7pm.  Following the taping the group may go to a nearby restaurant for dinner.

You can join us for FREE, but again PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:30PM
results.name: FREE Tix - LIVE Taping of Comedy Central's The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore

results.description: Meet up for Drop in Soccer at Meisel Park in Springfield 278 Meisel Avenue - Springfield, NJ 07081. We usually play in the back field (you have to go over a bridge to find the field) unless there's a kids game in process, if that happens, we will play in another field. Warm ups start after 5:00 pm and the game starts around 6:00pm.  Weather permitting!

results.description:
WordPress now powers almost 25% of the web and I am sure that whether you are a WP / PHP hater or lover, you have used it once if your life. If yes, then it is really important for you to know if you are making the best use of WordPress or not. 

Along with this, we will also go through WooCommerce & Sensei . WooCommerce is an E Commerce plug in where as SenSei is a LMS [ Learning Management System ] that helps you to set up a website like udemy.  

Join me on 19th at 5 pm to discuss WordPress, WooCommerce and Sensei at WeWork Chelsea. 

See you later guys.

Thanks!

Pratik G.
results.name: WordPress, WooCommerce & Sensei : Are you doing it the right way?

results.description:
Monday, October 19, 6:30 PM
Pre-event reception at 5:30 PM

Enter at 58th Street and 8th Avenue, SW Corner

This panel discussion features an exclusive group of influential designers and technologists exploring the ways in which a diversity of perspectives helps enhance creativity and drive innovation, despite prevailing barriers. Design and technology are progressive and forward-thinking arenas, but how inclusive are they really? How might individuals’ ethnicity, gender, race, sexual orientation, or socioeconomic level affect their perspective on design? The conversation will explore these and other pressing questions as it probes the complicated relationship between diversity and design. This program celebrates the fifth issue of Pratt’s publication Differentiate by Design (DxD), which showcases the Institute’s many corporate engagements. DxD5 celebrates diversity in design and asks the question, how can we do better?

RSVP
https://giving.pratt.edu/pages/pratt-presents-diversity-in-design?erid=1479297&trid=033d8c3c-34eb-4160-a37b-7f17eedebe13
results.name: Diversity in Design

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.

I am limiting the number of attendees. If you have attended Monday Bear Mountain hikes with me regularly, I will likely add you should the hike become full. That being said, I reserve the right to remove you if I am not familiar with you.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of a fast paced event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Dear friends,

Thank you for making our weekly Social Monday's a great success.

Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to socialize, and make new friends.

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members: you guys rock!Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes.

Come and get rewards by: 

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Playing our games

None of which are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH MONDAY'S/SOCIAL MONDAY'S/ (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last events

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

With so many great real estate investment, foreclosure and distressed properties seminars all over New York, which one do you choose? 

You get anevent for socializing, one-on-one talks and networking for the commercial investor and all services-attorney, architect, owner, investor, contractor, title companies, engineers, lenders- related to your commercial investments.

You get to know each other; help each other finding, funding and syndicating deals and with the deal analysis.

You've already joined, so come out to the meetings and enjoy the company of people with your same interests and aspirations.


There is never a charge for this meeting, but the venue ask's for a one drink minimum per person. (does not have to be alcohol)

PS There will be three other groups coming to this meeting, so the count is actually higher
